Reviews.Title: “beachfront gem”
Reviews.Author: NyTravlgirl
Reviews.Content: just returned from California and have to say our stay here was great! true the hotel is a little dated, but you can't beat the location, views or amenities! I would tell anyone to stay here and we would go back in a heartbeat! the hot tub was awesome, pool temp not so heated, as our week of weather was unusually cool for the season the hot tub was a bonus! parking was a little tricky...you can find a spot on the street for free and your car will be safe...the spots are so tight everywhere! there are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby that you can walk anywhere if able and not have to break the bank. also a ralph's supermarket like 2 blocks away that you can stock up on snacks,water etc...just be sure to ask the clerk for the ralph's card so you can get the store discounted prices. this hotel was very clean, staff was great, it may be a little pricey but well worth it! the beach is beautiful and plenty of rental equipment(bikes,surfing) if you need so close by. very happy with the choice we made to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Extended stay at Blue Sea Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Mary H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Blue Sea Lodge for three months (Jan thru March) while visiting my daughter, who lives in San Diego 4 miles away. We can only commend this hotel for being par excellence in service, hospitality, cleanliness, and a willingness to go the extra mile for us on every occasion. The Front Desk and hotel staff had a great attitude throughout our stay. From every room there is a view of the ocean. It is in a prime location being right on the beach. It is very quiet in the evening for sleeping especially on the pool side. The mattresses are good too. We felt very safe because of the security in the building and parking underneath. They also offer great chocolate chip cookies in the afternoon. the kids love them and so did we. After three months we had not one complaint. We plan to return there next winter. Mary Hines, Cape Cod MA

Reviews.Title: “Great room for Family... amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: yesiloves2travel
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time here... booked a "regular" room... with hopes of getting a better deal for a room with a view once we got there... and we did! Literally a couple of feet from the sand... the room had a microwave, mini fridge, coffee maker and a little sink area and 2 queen beds, and was very clean... The best part of course is the balcony (our corner room on the 1st floor) with the amazing view of the ocean... We could watch the kids playing in the sand from our balcony, and that was so convenient. Would definitely come back... but do get the room with a view!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: shurtliffp
Reviews.Content: What more can you ask for ....Beautiful location/clean rooms/friendly staff! I love this hotel (fun or business) Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend time on the beach”
Reviews.Author: enjoying_retirement
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Sea Lodge for several days. They were very friendly and accommodating. We came in early and they provided us a card so we could access the bathrooms and other facilities. The facilities are very good and kept up. The room was very comfortable and clean. We had an ocean view room with a view of the pool and hot tub and could hear the ocean waves at night. There is a charge of $17 per day for parking. We were not there during a busy period so we were able to park on the street right in front of the motel. Busy periods and weekends tie up the available street parking. We did have to disable the Windows Firewall on the computer to get the wireless to work but other than that everything went very well. The mission beach area is a very active area with many restaurants and activities. We went to San Diego just to spend time on the beach and the Blue Sea Lodge was a perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place for Sand and Sun in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Zaphod010101
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the hotel. The location is awesome and only steps away from the beach. When we come back to the San Diego area we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay of Our Trip”
Reviews.Author: Trish H
Reviews.Content: Loved the view from this hotel, even though we had only a "Partial View" room. The kitchenette in our room was a pleasant surprise as well. Nice pool and hot tub, but the best part was the location on the beach! Clean rooms, friendly staff - would definately book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: kevin c
Reviews.Content: Hi Had a nice stay, the area was awesome ..we are on the beach, walking distane to all needs and beatiful towns close by..the rooms were clean and the staff was super friendly. I stayed for 5 days with my 14 yerar old daughter and we loved San Diego.. My day was simple I woke up went to the gym which was a 2 minute walk not part of hotel but they gave me a 3 day comp pass.. then we had breakfast which was a 1 minute walk..lol. then took rental car and just drove to La jolla , Laguna beach, Cordona, Down town San Diego.. and if we didnt have a plan at the moment then we just drove around... The sunset was unbelievable watch it from a different location each night for different scenery for pictures.. one of the nights we watched from our Best western room on our bacony..we used enterprise rental and Jet blue..hope this helped someone.. have fun.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jim V
Reviews.Content: My wife and I Hadn't been to San Diego before and elected Blue Sea Lodge for our stay. Well; we couldn't have been happier....From the time we arrived, untill our check out, we were very pleased with all of the personel. The room was spotless and very well organized. We had a small problem with one of the screens in our suite and it took about 10 minutes from the time I called the front desk till the time the maintainence man showed up and repaired it instantly.. Also enjoyed the idea of not renting an automobile for our stay. Everything that is needed, from shopping to restaurants to sight seeing is available while walking..The views while walking are beautiful..I will recommend this facility to everyone I know. WE WILL BE BACK.......

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: lildeb43
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week before Thanksgiving, leaving the day after Thanksgiviing. The hotel was in the process of being painted, but it was being done with no negative effects on the guests. Everyone was helpful and accomodating. The front desk staff was very friendly. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and we had a suite right on the boardwalk. Excellent! Well located within walking/easy driving distance to everything we wanted. Great value for the price. I will definitely stay here again. Parking can get a little tight.

Reviews.Title: “A Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMel
Reviews.Content: I'm a local San Diegan that wanted to get away for a day. I decided to on a staycation at the beach. I've seen the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge and thought I would give it a try. I went at the end of February on a Saturday when I knew the beaches are far less traveled. I was told on the phone that check-in is at 4 p.m. but I could come as early as 2 p.m. if a room was available. I was at the hotel at 2 p.m. and was promptly told a room wasn't available but I could use the facilities. I decided to walk around the beach and get some lunch. I surprised I couldn't check in until 4 p.m. especially when I saw about 15-20 people at the hotel. The front desk personnel were very nice. I was told my partial view room was in the newer part of the hotel. I was surprised to find my partial ocean view was actually a full view of the Public Rest Room. I could see the ocean so the advertisement wasn't false. lol. My problem with this room came later in the evening when I was out on the patio ~ the homeless started arguing whether you can spend the night in a public rest room or not. I suggest you get you partial room in the old part of the hotel because that is closer to the beach. This is where the pool, spa and most of my fellow hotel guests were located during the day and evening. The common area was very nice and the other guests were very friendly. The beach view is fantastic and there are restaurants / bars / gift shops nearby. You can't beat the location. Later on during the evening I kept looking around the old / beach front section of the hotel trying to figure out why I had to endure the Public Restroom room. I noticed the majority of the older section wasn't rented out especially the third floor and beach front rooms. Best Western I kindly suggest you offer upgrades (free or paid) in the older building if they are available before you put people near the North side of the newer building. Would I stay here again? I'm not sure. If I do stay here again I would make sure the exact room I got. Or maybe I will stay at The Surfer hotel which is right next door and is a decent beach-front hotel without the room drama.

Reviews.Title: “our favorite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kathy M
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel right on the beach!! Service is 1st rate all the way around-very friendly from the minute you check-in. Restaurants and plenty of places to crab a bite to eat without driving. Just one of the reasons we like to stay there; you can walk to just about anything you might need so you do not have to waste time being in the car. Perfect location for anyone wanting to relax and enjoy the beauty of the ocean. The heated pool and spa are an added bonus as well. We stay at the Blue Sea Lodge everytime we come visit San Diego (which is usually 2-3 times a year)

Reviews.Title: “...can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: Tyger1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Blue Sea Lodge several times and have always been pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: rac93
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the staff is nice and the hotel rooms are beautiful! We come here every year and will be back for spring break in a couple weeks, I can't wait! Location: Mission beach is beautiful, very touristy and the kids love it. Blue Sea Lodge is sitting right on top of it, which is perfect because then you don't have to really plan on going to the beach, you can go whenever! Morning walks, day time swims, moonlight strolls, its all right there! Rooms: The rooms are always clean and totally adorable. They are average size, with nice bedrooms and a good closet. Can't complain! Staff: This is the best staff ever. They are constantly happy and always handing out little toys to kids and fresh baked cookies! When you are walking out the door, they ask where you're going, always have directions available, and 9/10 times have a coupon available to! Coupons they offered us: Sea World, restaurants, a boat trip around the bay (Sea Port Village) and San Diego Zoo (really, if you're going there, make sure to ask for a coupon!! It can get expensive) Seriously, if you are on the fence about this hotel for a family vacation, couples vacation, whatever, book it now!! Booking fill up fast and trust me, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: Martha M
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect experience at the Best Western Plus Blue Sea Lodge. The location is perfect and the girl who greeted us at the front desk was terrific. She was fun and upbeat and gave us wonderful restaurant suggestions. The room, halls, stairway, pool and whirlpool were spotless with not even sand visible. The hotel sits right on the boardwalk so you can people watch from your recliner through the spot free plexiglass panels. The persoat he front desk was friendly, too, and allowed me togetin my beach walk before we checked out. This place really works to make your stay perfect. We will make this a yearly visit.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Dale M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at this Best Western. It's sort of in the "party" area of San Diego. Now while we weren't in San Diego to party, we still enjoyed the atmosphere at the Blue Sea Lodge. The staff are very friendly and courteous. The rooms are good, and the ocean view rooms are really nice. The elevators were out of service the day we checked out, which was inconvenient. But, I understand this sort of thing happens from time to time and the staff was apologetic. If we ever visit San Diego again, we'll stay at the Blue Sea Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: Bailey1410
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the BEST stay at the Best Western PLUS Blue Sea Lodge. The staff was so welcoming and made us feel like family. We enjoyed our ocean view balcony and great sunsets over the Pacific Ocean. I'd suggest splurging and going for a suite! Can't wait to get back to the Blue Sea Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, quality, entertainment, and a killer view.”
Reviews.Author: aquaregia
Reviews.Content: Little do you expect what awaits on the inside when you pull into the parking lot. That all changes once you walk inside. The builing is very clean and fresh and offers great views of Pacific Beach. The staff is helpful and considerate. There are shops and bars seconds away, yet the crashing waves void out the sound of the music and people. It was a refreshing way to end each of my work days. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for your buck in Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: T S
Reviews.Content: Let me just start off by saying I am in my late twenties, very outgoing during the day, and enjoy getting out at night. This hotel was very well kept, has a good helpful staff, and is perfectly situated at the beach. I spent over a month researching the different hotels in the areas based on price, reviews, and location. The price was actually negotiated lower over the phone by about 17% as well as getting a free night of parking thrown in ($10 value). The bars/clubs are about a 10 minute walk away on Garnet Ave. There seemed to be a mixed age group of guests - nobody complained about our 2am return. Our room was in pretty good condition. There were efforts to upgrade some amenities like fridge, microwave, AND a nice flat screen TV, but other amenities were just average... which was fine by me! NO bugs or anything like that. Clean sheets/towels.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Going Back!!”
Reviews.Author: Gwen M
Reviews.Content: Just can't describe the beautiful view from our room. You have to go there and experience it. Located on the beach and in front is a paved walkway for miles to shopping, restaurants, bars, etc. Staff was friendly - room was comfortable - GREAT location and vacation. Thank You!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people!! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Ann S
Reviews.Content: It is a great location. The hotel was clean, people helpful, quiet location. Great views and walking/riding area. I went with my 2 daughters ages 14 and 22. We had a great time. The only bad thing was paying for parking(at hotel), not sure why you have to pay, they have a nice sized parking lot, may be more crowded in summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: DQFamily468
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed stayed this past christmas and had a fantastic holiday.When you arrive you are greeted by caring,knowledgable staff who are committed to customer service.The lobby is set in a beach theme,complete with surfboards on the wall.While this hotel does not have a restaurant on site,it does have a small cafe stand for all coffee and pastry needs and there is a lot of restaurants close by,including Tony Romas.The rooms were clean and spacious and they offer rollerway beds for a fee.We had 2 double beds but needed a rollerway for our daughter.The beach was 50 feet away for you to enjoy sunbaking or a nice casual stroll along the shore in the evening.Walking down the esplanade,between the hotel and beach,there are plenty of gift shops,bars and eateries to fill your hunger.Its a great location to travel to amusement parks,with buses and taxis close by the hotel.Being a business owner in BC Canada,we enjoy our free time as a family and Blue Sea Lodge was the place to stay near the beach in San Diego.Yes we will be back again and Thanks again to Bob,on the front desk who made our holiday what it was,absolutely faboulous.

Reviews.Title: “Steps from the beach”
Reviews.Author: SamburuChief
Reviews.Content: The building is a bit non-descript, but is being continuously renovated. They offer outdoors or garage parking. The breakfast place is greasy and rather rudimentary. There is no restaurant on site, but there are many around. The elevator and the hallways are rather creepy. The rooms range between OK and very good. Sea front rooms are expensive. If you get a room on the North side, close to the Sea and on second or third floor, the view is exceptional and the prices are more reasonable. The beach is 50-60 feet. Good location to combine a beach holiday with Sea World and Balboa Park. Itâ€™s not a Marriott or Hyatt, but been there twice so far and plan to go back again â€“ I think thatâ€™s my best recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “BEACH what else?”
Reviews.Author: radew
Reviews.Content: My son and I delighted in the supportive atmosphere of Cesar and many of his energetic co-worker/students staffing the desk at this well-managed hotel. A few footsteps from the beach, left or right to vistas and meals, shopping and exercise, we had a blast. Management planned cement work around the jacuzzi during their off season, which was the middle of our vacation - drag for us - callous disinterest on management's part not to convey such a change in the available services... IF IT HAD NOT BEEN FOR THE STAFF, we would have moved out. THANK YOUR QUALITY EMPLOYEES!

Reviews.Title: “Location and quality”
Reviews.Author: Stanandapril
Reviews.Content: What can I say-on the beach in PB? It's not the Ritz, but for a quality room, AWESOME LOCATION, good customer service, and comfortable night's sleep-this is the place. No, I wouldn't spend all day in my room, but its San Diego-why would you? Microwave, fridge, nice shower, comfortable bed, and you can fall asleep listening to the Pacific Ocean with the next morning's surf session waiting for you!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Mission Beach”
Reviews.Author: dotNewark
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here: 11/2/11, 11/9/11. The weather was not so hot but that didn't stop us. The best thing about this hotel was the location. On the beach and walkable just about anywhere for shopping, restaurants and Ralph's for groceries. The hotel is a little older but very clean and they were painting on the outside when we left. Service was good and the maids are thoughtful to your needs. There is pool and hot tub in front view of the ocean. Only draw back is that parking is not included: Cost is $16.00 a night and if you have a car, trying to find a parking space on the street is impossible. We had a second floor room 212 with view of the pool and partial view of the ocean. Bus service is a block away and we were able to take the bus into Old Town and the city, $1.25 one way for seniors and (weekly bus passes are reasonable). We would stay there again. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience So Far”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel experience I have had so far. Usually I stay at cheap motels like Motel 6, but they have been letting me down. I happened to be staying at a dumpy Motel 6 in San Diego on Veteran's Day and came across this place online. Their rate for a partial ocean view room with a king bed on Veteran's Day (a Friday night) was $79. The room was immaculate in comparison to the Motel 6. Everything smelt fresh, the bathroom was very clean and it was nice having such a spacious room. I don't know about other rooms, but room 509 with a partial ocean view on the third floor was perfect in my opinion. The down side to this place is paying $16 for parking and the garage has barely any clearance so just to be safe park next to registration if you can. Also, I thought the breakfast was continental, but apparently they charge for everything. I paid 10 dollars for 2 bagels with cream cheese and one tiny orange juice. Usually I would not pay that unless I am starving. Also, the employees are not all that. They were not rude to me, but they don't know how to explain where rooms are and when I walked up to the counter I had to say "Excuse me" so I could ask a question, kindly interrupting the 2 staff members' important conversation. But I slept here with my boyfriend very, very comfortably. I was expecting to hear way more noise at night than we did. Overall, though, I was very very pleased with my stay especially since the beach is right there! I will definitely stay here again if I can get a nice deal like that again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: CCL_JO
Reviews.Content: You can't argue with the location of this hotel - it's right on the beach and walking distance to several restaurants. Even if you don't have a room with a view, you can take a chair near the pool and look out onto the beach and ocean. However, the hotel itself is a bit dated. The room was adequate and clean, but had kind of a strange layout. The main problems were that the room was kind of dark (not in a view room) and sound carried from other rooms and the hallway so it was loud at times. Also the wifi didn't work in our room so I had to go to the lobby to use their computer. Although not perfect, I think it was a pretty fair dollar value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location but that's it...”
Reviews.Author: Arizona_Mike_74
Reviews.Content: Location is right on the beach - I had a partial view room and had a great view of the beach. The staff is not very friendly and had no clue about policies (they told me that the entire bill would be charged to my card ahead of time in the form of a "hold" but this is only hotel policy during summer months and did not happen). I paid $170 a night for a very mediocre room. The TV was very old, the carpet was worn, and the decor was outdated. The room was clean but very run down. On top of all that they charge an additional $16 a night for parking (there is public parking next to the hotel but it is ALWAYS full because it is next to the beach and a restaurant). The parking garage has only a six foot clearance so I did not want to risk trying to park my Xterra there - I parked in the small lot next to reception. There is also no continental breakfast. There is a small snack bar but their coffee is $2 and horrible. All that being said the location is the best possible - right on the beach. Some restaurants walking distance and Sea World is only ten minutes away. I would probably stay here again if I wanted to be right on the beach but that is the only reason. The staff, amenities, rooms, and everything else about this hotel sucks. Also, don't eat at the restaurant right next door - overpriced mediocre seafood. Joe's Crab Shack was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Family loved This Location”
Reviews.Author: lebowski00
Reviews.Content: I took my Family to stay at the Blue Sea Lodge Sept. 16th in 2011. Since it was the off season the hotel was not too busy. It was a quiet room but nothing fancy. It was head and shoulders better than many places we have stayed. The room was completely adequate as far as condition and noise. The location is exceptional. The beach is literally right there and the pool was a huge hit with the kids. Now some of these other hotels say they are right on Pacific Beach but they really are not. This is the place with the view and location you want! The only way I would think twice about bringing my family here would be if it was spring break. I would imagine their must be a time of year college kids flock these beach hotels. For me in September when my family went this place was outstanding. If you have a family and want to see how my family did our southern California vacation look around and check my posted vacation (assuming I can figure out how to do this soon then I will show. Our vacation was awesome with the one exception of a horrid Days Inn in Anaheim. I added a couple photos but I have not uploaded all of my photos to this computer yet so I will post a room one later if I remember. Hope this was helpful and you have an awesome vacation in California!

Reviews.Title: “Just plain fun!”
Reviews.Author: ittybittyboo
Reviews.Content: You will love this place, stay if you have the chance. It's right on the ocean and plenty to do and eat. Just a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Visit”
Reviews.Author: Robin O
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Best Western PLUS Blue Sea Lodge and totally enjoyed our stay. We called as we were arriving in town and were able to check in very early and the staff had upgraded our room to a partial ocean view, which was fantastic. The hotel is right on the beach and we could hear the surf from our room. We kept the patio door open at night never slept better. There is free wi-fi and a nice little cafe in the lobby for breakfast or lunch. There is a bit of dampness but that's expected from a place located right on the beach. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: summerlander33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in the beginning of October. They upgraded our rooms to the pool side suites at no charge. Our rooms were spacious, clean, with comfortable beds. We absolutely loved the suites, and would pay the extra for them given the opportunity to go back. We also loved that the hotel was right on the beach, easy walking to everything we needed. The front desk staff were very polite, and helpful. We would highly recommend this hotel. We wished we had booked at least a week!

Reviews.Title: “If you like fraternities then this place is for you”
Reviews.Author: Greco65
Reviews.Content: Stay there at the end of September. The room was dirty. The hallways smell like urine & pot. Sparking of pot , smelled it every nite. It's a young roudy crowd that stays at the Best Western. The room next to me had a blow up doll on the balcony. The area is very dangerous at nite. Much better to stay close to downtown where its safe and plenty of things to do. This place is a dumpand they got the nerve to charge 172 a nite. Lol. You can find a nice hotel downtown. You have been warned !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice employees”
Reviews.Author: ErnieTeri2
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Oct 4th. We stayed for 2 nights and were really happy with our partial ocean view. We could actually enjoy the ocean from our room, with a good view. The staff there made our stay really nice, got us into our room early. The rooms were nice and quiet, clean & had comfy beds. We could walk to most places but were glad they had parking. We really enjoyed our stay and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Blue Sea Lodge”
Reviews.Author: LarryandChrisM
Reviews.Content: Once again location location location, Blue Sea Lodge has it all, right in the center of Pacific Beach, great location for Sunsets, daily walks on the Boardwalk, and searching for sand dollars, shark teeth, and shells. Hotel staff is the best, very helpfull, (thanks again Bob for all your help), rooms are a little tired but if your staying on the beach your not in the room long enough to notice. Everything you need is in walking distance, however there's plenty to do all over San Diego, sightseeing, golf, shopping, train rides, amusement parks the works.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: SherryLynn1961
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying at the Blue Sea Lodge and it's all about location! You've got to have an ocean front room on the second or third floor so you can leave the balcony door open and go to sleep and wake up to the sound of the ocean just outside your door! Just steps away from the boardwalk, beach & ocean!!! Close to restaurants, bars, coffee, amusement park and activities. Minutes from the airport and minutes from La Jolla. The staff was very friendly and helpful. And the fresh-baked cookies in the afternoon are a little bonus!

Reviews.Title: “My Long-Time Oceanfront 'Second Home'”
Reviews.Author: BillyRave
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve been a â€˜regularâ€™ guest (two or three times annually) at the Blue Sea since I discovered it in 1984, at which time its solar heating system (long since gone) made it a stand-out among other ocean front properties. Itâ€™s gone through other changes since then, including ownership and numerous managers, but two things have remained constant drawsâ€“its immediate proximity to the ocean, and the friendliness and helpfulness of its management and staff. The hotel is modest in size, three floors, 128 rooms, and shaped like a lower-case â€˜hâ€™, with the feet being the full ocean view rooms directly on the boardwalk (which is between the building and the beach), and the sides and â€˜stemâ€™ being partial view rooms (looking at the ocean on an angle). Registration is in the â€˜stemâ€™ of the â€˜hâ€™, along with a modest cafÃ© and lounge area, and a computer terminal free for guestsâ€™ use. The original building, way back even before my time, was all-suite, and most (not all) of those suites were eventually divided into individual rooms, so you have a sense of sizing â€“ some rooms are quite tight! Rooms include a mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, free high-speed internet access, small safe (big enough for a small camera bag), plush terry robes (which can be purchased), and at least in the full ocean views (the only rooms I reserve), flat-screen TVs on the wall. Each wing of the â€˜hâ€™ has a laundry room, and an elevator - but itâ€™s quicker to climb a flight or two of stairs. The hotel has its own parking lots, both above and below ground, and charges a daily fee for parking. One caveat â€“ the spaces seemed designed for mid-sized or smaller vehicles, and half the guests arrive in SUVs and pickup trucks, which can make squeezing into a slot a challenge, especially on sold-out summer weekends! The hotel cafÃ© has limited hours and serves light fare, but there are a score or more restaurants within a short walk along the boardwalk or Mission Blvd (the main drag paralleling the shore), including two - World Famous (excellent seafood) and Tony Romaâ€™s - right across the street (and the front desk often has discount coupons for some other of the local restaurants). Just about every other shopping necessity can be found within a short walk, including a major supermarket and drug store, and Garnet Avenue, the main shopping and entertainment district of Pacific Beach, is only a few blocks away. The main feature of the hotel, of course, is its immediate proximity to the beach and its attendant activities. Enjoy jogging, skating and cycling on the miles long paved boardwalk between the hotel and sand, and swim, surf, and boogie-board in the (generally gentle) ocean swells; rental accessories for all those activities can be found within a short walk of the hotel. And at dayâ€™s end, thereâ€™s nothing much more relaxing than sitting on oneâ€™s balcony, in the cool ocean breeze, watching the sunset. With the surf right outside my balcony door, and management and staff that has always been more than cooperative in making my stay enjoyable, I expect Iâ€™ll be returning for many more years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location on the beach, hotel could use an update”
Reviews.Author: coloboarder
Reviews.Content: Great location on the beach. Good restaurants close by. Hotel could use an update/refresh for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Wonderful view.”
Reviews.Author: JillMPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We planned a trip to the ocean for a little re-group vacation. The one thing that was really important to us was staying somewhere that had a direct ocean view and where we could leave the windows/door open to hear the waves at night. We selected the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge for these reasons and because they were running a specail on rooms, which brought the cost substantially lower than other beach hotels. We were not disappointed. We parked the car in the garage and didn't move it again until we left. Everything that we needed/wanted was within walking distance. The beach was steps from the hotel and there were many eating establishments within walking distance. The room was clean and the hotel was quiet. The staff was friendly and nice. Our room had a direct view of the ocean and when we weren't out on the beach, we were able to sit on the balcony and enjoy the ocean. The only negative was that the wireless internet didn't work in our room and I had brought some work with me to do while on vacation. I decided that this wasn't a bad thing in the end because it forced me to take a vacation. They did have a guest computer in the lobby of the hotel with internet access that allowed me to check/send any work related emails that I felt needed to be taken care of now. When we return to CA for our next beach trip, we will return to the Blue Sea Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: niki-col
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at blue sea lodge . Rooms were small but very clean , plus who stays in the room it serves its purpose. Its in a great location little bit of this and that all around it,food and things to do. Beautiful beach in front of it.i would stay again .

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time, very relaxing and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego for a solo surf vacation and picked this hotel due to it's location to the beach. It's right on the water, basically, and I could just stand outside the hotel and check the surf without having to even leave my room, fabulous! Check-in was very easy, my room was comfortable and clean. The staff was very courteous and friendly. I was concerned that since my room was near the pool that it would be loud but it wasn't, not at all, never an issue. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was the BEST”
Reviews.Author: Sally L
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many resorts some 5 star, but none compared to Blue Sea for customer service. The rooms are very clean, the bed is great. The employees were fantastic, all friendly and caring. I have to say Caesar and Bobby were the best and definitely our favorite. The view couldn't be better and the sounds of the ocean brought peace and lulled us to sleep every night!! We loved our visit, even extended an extra day. We will definitely come back. The restaurant across the street "World Famous" was great, and very reasonable. You truly couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills, But Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ade318
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right on the beach and in the center of all the restaurants. Night clubs are within walking distance. It's far enough away from the nightlife if you're having a family vacation. The rooms are decent and equipped with a fridge and microwave. Nice location if you're planning on going into the city or visiting La Jollla and want a vibrant beach scene. If you have very young children and want to stay on the beach, I would recommend La Jolla. It's low-key, family friendly, and absolutely beautiful. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My one concern is that the printer was "out of order" for our entire 6 day stay and one of the amenities is a "business center".

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise this was!”
Reviews.Author: funtroopers4
Reviews.Content: I was doing a coastal road trip with the kids along the So Cal coast over spring break and found this place online. It was rated as one of the Top 10 Oceanfront hotels in San Diego. At first glance online, it looked a little cheesy from their longshot photo. But it did look like it had the Best Location (on the beach, on the strand, close to Belmont Park and Wave House), AND it had a pool and jacuzzi facing the ocean. So I got a great rate on their website and booked a one night stay. When we checked into our room, WOW our sliding glass door opened up to the pool / jacuzzi area facing the Ocean! This is a Best Western and we have this & parking & Free Wi-Fi! There is also along of yummy restaurants walking and driving distance from here. Our kids are accustomed to staying in some pretty fancy hotels. But to this day, this is one of their favorites. Only regret... we should have stayed one more night.

Reviews.Title: “Great time with teh kids. Great location...”
Reviews.Author: mikegodphx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when traveling with my three daughters for a weekend at Sea World. I was stunned at the great price for the hotel when it is literally on the boardwalk in Mission Beach. The accommodations are typical for a older hotel but we felt comfortable the whole time. There was a great breakfast place right on the beach for morning coffee and eats. We also ate at teh Tony Romas right on the corner. The rooms were very large and the beds were comfortable. We were off season so we liked having the pool there since the ocean was cold. We are going back for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, I would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: ilovelowly
Reviews.Content: Blue Sea Lodge is as close as you can get to the beautiful beach, located literally out the back gate of the pool area. Every night we left the windows open and fell asleep to the sound of crashing waves. The rooms are simple but comfy, with a fridge and a balcony, which are great. One night guests came into the courtyard at about 2:30 a.m., loud and playing in the pool. I called the front desk to let them know. In about 5 seconds the manager was there and in no uncertain terms told them to get out of the pool and go to bed. Fabulous. One thing I would skip is the breakfast area....it's stuff you'd find in a free continental buffet, but not free. Take advantage of the big grocery store down the street and the fridge in your room. I also wish there was more chairs in the pool area, but no biggie. Good choice for beachside San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Stay...”
Reviews.Author: jhedman123golf
Reviews.Content: My favorite vacation spot. We love it for its location. We park and never get back in the car all week. They work with our schedule. And you can't beat the view. Rooms are clean. Love the complementary water in the rooms. Lots of extras that make you feel like you are home away from home. Can't wait for our next stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Time02
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 10 glorious days in San Diego, where we stayed at the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge. We make mulitple, lengthy trips each year to San Diego and we always stay at the Blue Sea Lodge. After experiencing unpleasant stays at competors in the area, we found the Blue Sea Lodge about 15 years ago, and now consider it our home away from home. One could not pick a better location for a hotel than 100 yards from the beautiful Pacific Ocean with the qualified and dedicated staff that will greet you each time, you are guaranteed to have a very pleasant and high quality stay at this facility. We have found all of the staff, from the front office personnel to the housekeeping and maintenance technicans to all be very friendly and greatly concerned about making your stay as pleasant as possible. The executive management at the Blue Sea Lodge has done a very good job in the selection and training of all personnel and it shows with each contact you have with them. Words cannot describe the location, scenic views, local amenities, that you will find and experience at the Blue Sea Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Robert1968094
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not OK. The location might be right on the beach but the hotel is not worth the money. Small, old and not clean rooms. The worst is that they rent us a room with a non working airconditioner of wich they knew that it wasn't working! A shameless price of $350 per night is not ok for what you get. We where supossed to stay for a week but left after one night. Do not go to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: EllGio
Reviews.Content: What a perfect place to wake up ! Right on the boardwalk. The first room we were given had a problem with the plumbing but they moved us to another room and upgraded our room on our next visit. We've stayed 3 times already and cannot get over the view. The rooms are basic, but nice compared to some beachfront properties we've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: coaders
Reviews.Content: When I booked the room that breakfast was included- it was not. We had to wait past the check in time to get our room. The floor in the room was disgusting. It felt damp and even after a shower I had to wipe my feet off before getting into bed because they got so dirty. I bent over to get something under the bed and it smelled like pee. The elevators smelled awful. The pool was too cold to swim in, not heated. One of the pillows disappeared when the maid service came. I had to call 3 times and go down to the front desk to get it replaced. For the price it is not worth it. There is nothing plus about this hotel. It was more like a motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location right on the beach, ok rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TotallyTink
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location right on the beach and within walking distance to many restaurants and shops. We reserved a room with partial ocean view with a king-sized bed. They gave us a room with a queen sized bed but I was so tired the first night that I didn't realize it. When I later questioned the bed size, I was told that we were given the room with the best partial ocean view but that room has a queen instead of a king in it. They said they should have mentioned it at check in but nobody did. This was a disappointment because we had reserved the room type for the king bed not for the partial ocean view. I didn't ask to be moved to another room because we were only staying 2 nights and I didn't feel like moving my stuff for just one more night. The room and bathroom were clean. The room was a little outdated but not too bad. The refrigerator was very convenient. The balcony was a good size and the partial ocean view (room 257) was decent. The room was a little smelly but it was fine after it aired out with the balcony door open. Unfortunately when we closed the door the smell would return. The temperature outside was fantastic so we slept with the sliding door open. The front desk was helpful directing us to local restaurants. World Famous restaurant is located right across the lot but it was really crowded. The front desk gave us a VIP card that allowed us to get seated almost right away. The hotel has adequate parking. There is a $16 per day fee for parking. I would probably stay at this property again because it was a good value for a hotel right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE BEST HOTEL ON THE BEACH IN SAN DIEGO”
Reviews.Author: gater4343
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in almost every hotel on the coast in San Diego and found the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge to be the all around best time. You wont find a better place to stay in Pacific Beach. Bring the kids the bikes the boogie boards and get ready for a great time. I have never gone on this kind of site before but wanted to spreed the word to anyone looking for a great beach experiance. They have a guy that works there Cesar is his name ask for him and tell Cesar MR GATES sent you.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for beach vacation!”
Reviews.Author: hlhawker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on our honeymoon here. We are young and couldn't afford a fancy resort so we stayed here and it was so nice. There are food places within walking distance along with bike rental places and all sorts of cool stuff! It was so nice being able to walk right out onto the beach whenever you want. We stayed for 5 nights and didn't have to rent a car. We rented bikes and rode everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice location, but the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lohryt
Reviews.Content: As it has been stated numerous times, The Blue Sea Lodge is in an excellent location and I concur. There are multiple restaurants, stores, and shoppes within a few hundred feet and especially within a 2 block perimeter. Obviously, this is a beachfront hotel, and it would be nearly impossible to get any closer to the beach for this hotel's value anywhere in San Diego. I could take like ten paces, and I was literally on the sand. On a 1- 10 scale, I would easily rate the location of the hotel a 10 without any question. The staff was extremely nice and helpful and I would rate them very high as well. ( 9- 10). However, the actual hotel structure ,rooms, and amenities are a complete contrast ,and I was still disappointed even though I had expected meager accommodations based on my research. I stayed in an oceanfront room on the first floor, and the view was outstanding, but that's where the compliments end. I'm really being sincere and truthful when I state the following : My room literally was worse than those old grimy motels that you find off the freeway in the middle of nowhere. This is literally the very worse room that I have ever stayed in and no other hotel room even comes close to matching this room. From my understanding, the oceanfront rooms are some of the better rooms. If that's the case, there is no way I could stay in the non-ocean view rooms, besides without the view, the rooms are worthless. My room was extremely small and uncomfortable to move around without bumping into my wife. The patio was nice but other other quests can easily cross your "open" barrier into your space. The bed was sufficient and comfortable. The television was okay but was lacking in channels,however I didn't care about watching tv. The AC unit is from the stone age, but it works very well ,however I rarely needed it with the nice weather. The bathroom had very slow draining sinks but overall sufficient even though unremarkable. Overall, the room was tiny, dingy, very outdated with fitly carpet, but they kept the rooms and hotels as clean as possible from what I could ascertain. I had no problems finding parking spaces, but if you have a larger sized vehicle, you will sometimes need to park in two spaces because they are very small. The lobby lounge is extremely limited in food and completely worthless especially since there is a store and other dinning options approximately one hundred feet from the hotel. As far as the swimming pool, my bathtub is larger than that very very small pool but it has a good view of the beach. i would recommend this hotel if you want a fabulous location and an excellent view of the beach at a very reasonable cost ,but just be aware that the rooms and the actual hotel is vey unimpressive, dated, and unappealing.

Reviews.Title: “lovely location”
Reviews.Author: MMO_Istanbul
Reviews.Content: the hotel is direct at the pacific beach therefore very convenient for sun&sea lovers as well as for joggers and leisure bikers. the property is very cozy and clean, the rooms were very tidy, blankets, sheets, towels were changed every day. hotel receptionists Bob and Melisa were very helpful during our registration and for our further requests. despite various other Best Western hotels offering free parking, the hotel's spacy parking lot was not free for hotel guests, a nightly fee is charged to the room account.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Knghthwk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and had such GREAT service!! We were going to stay at a hotel across the street. BUT the service over there was not good at all there was no air conditioning there either. so we moved at 1230am to Best Western. Vivian and Rick were great.. they even offered to help us move our stuff from one hotel to another... Vivian was able to give us an ocean view room for the 5 days we were there.. They made our 25 wedding anniversary special.. as well as my husband leaves for Afghanistan in July..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Awesome friendly Staff- Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: merdmb
Reviews.Content: This location just doesn't get any better! It's right in the heart of PB and you can walk to just about everything. The rooms are nice and good sized, free wifi, refrigerator in rooms is very nice, balcony with view to the water, hot tub was awesome bonus after running around all day. The staff is one of the best parts of the hotel- we were there for three nights/4 days and everyone we met was more than friendly and helpful! One employee we saw while strolling the boardwalk and he asked how everything was going- gave us great tips for restaurants and things to do- and he wasn't even working! The coffee/breakfast cafe downstairs is very nice and the kids LOVED the ice cream vending machine! Parking is extra- but if you know San Diego- parking is rare so it's very nice to have a huge lot!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Price”
Reviews.Author: katyjonz
Reviews.Content: This place is right on the boardwalk and beach. You can enjoy the pool and look at the ocean all at the same time. The room was clean and the amenities great. We would stay here again if we come to this area again.

Reviews.Title: “By the ocean”
Reviews.Author: CAThlen
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel while touring San Diego. We checked in a little early, and were given a room that had a queen size bed instead of the king size bed that we reserved. When we questioned this, we were given another room with the proper size bed, and although both rooms were "partial ocean view", the second room was superior (the first room also had an odor of disinfectant, view not as good, and it adjoined a connecting room). Our room had a small balcony which overlooked the pool area, did have partial ocean view, and we could hear the sound of the waves. We also had a small refrigerator. All of the hotel staff we encountered were pleasant, and staff at reception desk were helpful. Location was convenient to driving to tourist destinations in San Diego, and many restaurants were within walking distance. Even though it was too cool to swim in the ocean, staying at the beach was great. If we returned to San Diego, we would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Just Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lamist
Reviews.Content: We had some friends that were staying nearby, so we booked this hotel. We did get an ocean room with a balcony, which was nice. The room was just average, but it was clean. The pool area looked nice as well. The location is everything here - you can walk straight out to the beach and to a lot of restaurants, bars, etc., in the area. They do charge separately for parking and there isn't a breakfast. I think this is the first Best Western I have stayed at that didn't include breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Great rooms,Great pool!!”
Reviews.Author: the_gamekeeper
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the stop here and one of the best Best Westerns I've been to.The room was excellent,fantastic view and it was cleaned well every day.The location is also fantastic right on the seafront.For the money it is far better than the over priced and snobbish Catamaran across the road.Would definitely stop here again!

Reviews.Title: “over-priced, average at best, cleanliness and facilities poor”
Reviews.Author: Vinkent
Reviews.Content: I booked in here for 2 nights because it was such a lovely setting. I checked out after one. I had a room with no sea view which I knew when I checked in. I also had no air-conditioning, no wifi and the bath hadn't been cleaned properly. At 2 a.m. the security personnel did try and fix the air-conditioning. I cleaned the bath myself - I was too tired to sit around whilst someone cleaned the room they should have cleaned before I checked in. Parking is extra - and the carpark belongs to this motel, so it is just a hidden charge, very sly! Some of the desk staff are excellent, some just want to be entertained by chatting to the guests, they don't want any hassle. Wifi - one member of staff told me that 'we don't actually have wifi in all rooms', another the next morning told me that they do, it just needed a call to the ISP to reboot. Most people seem to have a good experience here, I didn't, but did move to Crystal Pier hotel a few blocks down - with a full sea view, wonderful setting, lovely clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Blue Sea Lodge is Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: CupcakeCA
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Blue Sea Lodge 3 times a year. The hotel is in the perfect location. We were there in April for Spring Break, Frankie was very funny and helpful! The staff work hard to keep the grounds very clean. We have stayed in several different types of rooms as have our family friends. We didn't really like the king room we had this stay. I prefer the king room with a wet bar. Parking is a little tight if you have a large SUV.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy - just a great place on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: thebigez34
Reviews.Content: The Blue Sea Lodge is a great place to stay if you're on vacation in San Diego. The hotel itself was pretty standard - nothing to detract but nothing pops out as amazing - but the location was perfect. Right on the beach, walking distances to dozens of restaurants, grocery stores, board and bike rentals and anything else you would need. If you stay, I recommend hitting up World Famous next door for a great breakfast. One downside - there was free WiFi but it was painfully slow at times (not that WiFi should really dictate your hotel choice).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Beachfront Value in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: joy94549
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Blue Sea Lodge located on San Diego's Pacific Beach was perfect for our family. The staff was always professional and friendly, the room was clean, comfortable and quiet, the pool and spa areas were clean and enjoyable and look out onto the ocean through a glass enclosure. There is gated underground parking available (extra charge). Many restaurants and shops are within walking distance. We also appreciated the mini refrigerator, microwave and small safe in the room.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lchannel6
Reviews.Content: This location is ideal for activities or just relaxing - the service was wonderful and the room with our view was fantastic. I highly recommend anyone staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Friendly Staff, Ideally situated in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: tighthea01
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated within a stones throw of the beach. Ideally located close to some amazing resturants and vibrant bars. Rooms are clean and spacious with great views of the Pacific Ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Jerry13
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here during our California vacation. Best part of the hotel is the location - right on beach. We had a partial ocean view room that looked out to the Northwest side and we loved the view. We loved hearing the waves when the door was open too. Yes, the room dÃ©cor needs updating, but it still served our purposes. It was clean, as we found nothing wrong with our room and yes we did look. Parking is $16 per night unless you can find free street parking right next to the hotel, as we did, so that helped. Maybe it was the time we were there, but we had no noise issues at all during our stay. I too wish that they would ban smoking in all areas of the hotel, but again we didn't have an issue. Loved waking up with coffee made in the room and then sitting on the balcony or going down to the pool area and looking at the beach and ocean. It was fun lying in the enclosed pool area, watching our kids play football, baseball, or whatever on the beach too. Best thing about this hotel is the location right on the beach, which is why we chose it and we were not disappointed in that. Also, the hotel staff was very nice, helpful and accommodating. Jason was also very helpful with our questions before we got there too. Cost would be a factor on staying there again, but we would stay there again if the opportunity would present itself and cost was not too high.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation on the beach”
Reviews.Author: pinkladies19
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on line. We got a great perspective via satellite. It looked amazing! The beach was right there off of the pool! We thought it was too good to be true! But we were so pleasently surprised to be able to lay out at the pool and watch the surfers in the ocean! We opened our sliding glass door and stepped out onto the balcony and saw the sun set over the pier. We walked up a block and found an amazing little Italian restaurant with the best lasagna around. Then we Walked back to our room and soaked in the hot tub! It was a dream hotel! We will definetely return! Lisa Shaw- Riverside, ca.

Reviews.Title: “Blue Sea Lodeg does not disappoint in terms of value and location...”
Reviews.Author: dameemer
Reviews.Content: For those of you who might question a stay at a Best Western, question no longer. From the time we arrived when Jason the manger who was very busy accommodating everyone including us, he gave excellent service in light of the fact that he was flying solo!!! He checked our bags and let us use the facilities until our room was ready, (we tried to check in around noon early). We walked the beach and Pacific Beach town for a bit and then were greeted by Cesar, the desk clerk who was busy trying to accommodate calls and check-ins but made time for us and even offered us an upgrade to an ocean front suite which was WELL worth every dollar!!! The staff were smiling and helpful as well as pleasant and we had a peaceful night's rest! Great location and staff and management who make sure that your stay is comfortable and that you know the area as well. Thank you, Cesar, Jason, AND Lupe for making us feel right at home:-)

Reviews.Title: “This met my expectation and would recommend it Lodge to everyone”
Reviews.Author: Deb0125
Reviews.Content: We enjoy yourself at the lodge and would recommend it to everyone who is looking for that breath taking view of the beach and the sound for beautiful night sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “ocean and bay proximity and views are priceless”
Reviews.Author: roen60922
Reviews.Content: Internet service is slow and intermittent...when staying here you should remember that the Pacific Beach & Mission Beach communities are; above all else; beach and party areas... attracting all ages...it can become noisy... but it is always stimulating... clubs; pubs and cafes are plentiful; within easy walking distance and the food is good quality; generous in portion; varied; and served at reasonable cost.. A Ralph's grocery is about 4 blocks away and has a great wine and liquor selection at very competitive prices..We have come back to stay here for 8 consecutive years...

Reviews.Title: “It is all about the location...”
Reviews.Author: parkerrays
Reviews.Content: The best part is that it is on the ocean (had a room with a partial ocean view) and the beach is your backyard. The not so great part is the cost - way overpriced (if you take out the location). The hot tub made extremely loud mechanical sucking sounds and had an interesting smell to it (don't ask!). The room decor desperately needs updating and the cleanliness leaves a lot to be desired (found some left over cereal behind the TV). A $16 per night parking fee is assessed (there really isn't any other option) and there is NO continental breakfast. You would think for the cost - these two amenities would be included. Because it is located next to a public parking area on the beach, noise can be heard at all hours of the night. Smoking is allowed near the pool area - which certainly counters the enjoyment of the ocean air. Sadly, Best Western has become a "hit or miss" chain when it comes to quality. Although we were disappointed with the accommodations, there is still nothing greater than being right next to the ocean!

Reviews.Title: “Surf,Fun, and anything you want to eat!!!”
Reviews.Author: shotokan33
Reviews.Content: To start, the front desk staff was very accomidating. I ask alot of questions(mostly where the good food was) Usually on business trips I end up eating the same old fast foods. On my first trip down to the desk, I was meet by a Mr. Templar. Young looking for a Assistant GM, but very energenic and quick with a knowing smile. He directed me to a Mexican food place by the roller coaster and I had my first fish taco( really tastey!!) He also said a good rib place would be Tony Romas' (which was very,very good) I don't usually write reviews but my stay would have been perfect if I did'nt have to work. This summer, the family and I are coming to the Blue Sea Lodge for real fun in the sun !!!

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: Robert0729
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay was a nice get -away in the ocean view and quiet room. This is an older but neat and tidy hotel and the remodeled rooms are clean and comfortable.The staff was friendly and most accommodating. The hotel is walking distance to many affordable restaurants and bars. We didn't visit San Diego or nearby attractions on this stay for all we wanted to do was visit with another couple who spent one day/night at the hotel, walk the beach and boardwalk that was right in front of our room.There is a privately owned very small eatery that provides breakfast & light lunch but we prefered to go out for better value and scenery. We were disappointed that breakfast wasn't included like in the other Best Western Hotels we've stayed at but other than that we greatly enjoyed our time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price and a Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: swimmer1016
Reviews.Content: My group and I were very impressed with the Good Price of of Hotel. Our rooms were very well equipped. We were close to restaurants and other amenities. The hotel made our get away a great time for all. The staff were friendly and gave us great advise on places to see. We would recommend this hotel to others. Beds were soft and comfortable and the rooms showed well.

Reviews.Title: “Yet Another Perfect Stay on PB”
Reviews.Author: TheFabsLV
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four-night stay at the BW Blue Sea Lodge and as always, it was a perfectly relaxing vacation at the best location on Pacific Beach - right ON the beach. There's nothing more wonderful than the view, sounds and scents of the ocean. Sitting on our third floor balcony to watch the waves, surfers and folks running on the beach with their dogs - awesome. And, of course, we sleep with the sliding glass door open and the ocean lulling us. Ahhhhhhhh. My husband and I have enjoyed this hotel four times and I've stayed there at least four times on my own and with a girlfriend. The accomodations have never disappointed (the shower water pressure is THE best of ANY hotel I've stayed in - important for this "big hair girl") and the staff members are all excellent - friendly, helpful... simply awesome! The location is beyond perfect for us. We always fly into San Diego and take transportation to/from the hotel as we have ZERO need for a vehicle while we're there. The Blue Sea is within walking distance of everything we want - great restaurants (seafood!), Ralph's market (to stock the fridge), laid-back beachside bars/coffee bars and Belmont Park's Giant Dipper roller coaster. Our only wish is that we could visit more often!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place on Pacific Beach!!”
Reviews.Author: jstewmo
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Blue Sea Lodge was a great value and it's locaton can not be beat. You are literally on the beach, with all of the shops, restaurants, and crazy nightlife all within walking distance. A great way to visit San Diego!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit, great staff & great location !”
Reviews.Author: lovethatocean
Reviews.Content: With each vacation, we have never stayed in the same hotel twice EXCEPT the Blue Sea Lodge ! The staff and the views are the reasons we returned. The place is clean & neat and we don't rent a car so the area is great for walking to restaurants. Oh, and then there's the ocean, well...it's beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach place”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorDan5
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel right on the beach in San Diego. Easy to get downtown. Not the fanciest, but good rates for nice spacious rooms with either partial or complete views of the Pacific. Worth the price to be right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: canucker77
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed! We were checked into our room even though we arrived hours before regular check in. The room was very clean, spacious, and we loved the oversized shower/tub. Best location on the beach, and the pool area was great. Our room was very quiet as well, so we slept great in the very comfortable bed. We also loved the room amenities. So happy to see an ironing board and iron as well as a hair dryer. My husband was shocked but pleased to see q-tips and cotton balls in the bathroom! We will be booking again in April for a much longer stay. Didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Beatty1058
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge. Great service...we asked to change to an ocean front room and they were able to accomodate us within the hour. Very friendly staff, clean rooms and the best location. Close to everything. We would recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Our Surprise Return”
Reviews.Author: Jerdawg1030
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a weekend away and booked this room at the Blue Sea Lodge over the MLK holiday weekend - myself, my wife, my son and one of his buddies. I actually found it from an email I got from Pacific Inns - a chain we like to use, primarily in Pismo Beach, Ca. As we pulled up I realized it was the same hotel my wife and I stayed at in January 1990 when we took a quick weekend away to celebrate our six months of marriage - I've not thought of that trip in years, but it came back to us quickly. It's grown quite a bit, but the view of the ocean and great location were unmistakable. The boys (both 19 yrs old) got their own room over looking the pool & my wife & I had the 3rd story room facing the beach - perfect. I don't recall our room number 21 yrs ago, but we had the same type of over-sized step down tub/shower & a very comfortable king size bed. We had an awesome weekend of relaxing - many good shops within walking distance if you want to pick up some beach wear. The local food was excellent too. Our rooms were very clean & ours had a nice HD TV. The boys rented wave runners in Mission Bay while my wife & I walked, had drinks, and a terrific lunch overlooking the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you to you for a great stay, seeing and hearing the ocean is the most incredible sight and sounds for me.”
Reviews.Author: cindylu998
Reviews.Content: Thank you for the great stay at the Blue Seas. I have stayed with you a number of times traveling for business. Your staff is always there to help at a moments notice. They are friendly and professional always. Staying at a hotel that is right on the ocean if such a gem! Being able to hear the ocean waves and to see the Pacific Sunset is most incredible and a beautiful sight. The boardwalk provides miles of walking or running. Also being within walking distance to many resturants is a major plus. Again, thank you and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “great service from Michelle at front desk”
Reviews.Author: catherinemcmillan
Reviews.Content: Check in service was very efficient and informative...nice to have restaurants so close by and the boardwalk right there...convenient for la Jolla and downtwon San Diego sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “It is a fantastic place to stay, helpful staff and not to mention the great location and view.”
Reviews.Author: britthamm
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Blue Sea Lodge for a week in late December 2010. The front desk staff were very friendly and helped us with anything we needed. We asked them about bus routes, directions and we asked them for recommendations for places to eat. Their recommendations were fantastic, they really knew the area! It was also very nice to have warm cookies every evening in the lobby to greet us after a long fun-filled day. I would also like to mention their personnal transportation services, we were driven to our whale excursion and to the airport by the transportation service and it was a nice ride. The driver talked with us and told us about the area; he even took us on a scenic route so we could see some of the city scenery. The area that the hotel is in is a great place with manly affordable resturants and a lot of souvenior shops on the board walk. The boardwalk and beach is literally right outside the hotel and the Crystal Pier is a short walking distance. We watched the sunset everynight from the pool area or from just outside the hotel. We booked a partial ocean view room and the view from our hotel room was fantastic, it exceeded our expectations greatly. My daughter and I enjoyed our trip a lot and with the hotel staff`s help, we have memories that will last forever! We have recommended the hotel to all of our friends and family. If/when we are able to come back, we will definetly stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place at pacific beach”
Reviews.Author: giap_tran
Reviews.Content: Stay here for 4 days at Blue Sea Lodge in Dec 2010 . I have checked other nearby hotels , and Blue Sea Lodge seems to be the best deal . The weather is really nice except one rainy day .

Reviews.Title: “Added Perks”
Reviews.Author: Stuart3390
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff are awesome, always friendly, and always available to assist in whatever request I have. The hotel itself is great too; the beds and pillows were very comfortable, the pool and hot tub, were perfect and they are keen on keeping the hotel updated. Besides the above, I like the place for the added benefits. I can run on miles of boardwalk or beach, I can walk to many great restaurants or bars, and it is close to many attractions/work locations. Did I mention the view? Sunset on the Pacific Ocean, many sites to look at! Very relaxing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Pool”
Reviews.Author: VancouverIslandNews1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Although it looks a bit rough on the approach, including the lobby, not to worry it is good. Very friendly staff. The pool and hot tub are fantastic with a door located there with steps to the beach. Asked for a robe 3 times and never got it but they seemed to be trying. Best Mexican food is one block away at the Taco Shop, so eat there.

Reviews.Title: “This is our third visit! Not fancy, but fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: rbr0wn
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to the Blue Sea Lodge on Pacific Beach. During the off-season it's quiet and relaxing. We felt like we had the motel and beach to ourselves. Yes, it's crowded and pretty noisy during the summer months, but we left our door open to the beach all night during this visit and heard very little noise. Service is terrific. We checked in early without a problem. Our room was a bit small and they moved us to a larger one on the second floor right away. This place isn't fancy or glamorous, but if you're looking for a great place to stay that's right on the beach and close to lots of restaurants, bars, and things to do, you'll love it! Our room was equipped with a microwave and small refrigerator. There is a grocery store and liquor store within walking distance. My husband enjoyed sitting out on the balcony, drinking his beer, and watching the people go by. We didn't even bother to rent a car because there are so many things to do within walking distance. If you bring a car, they do charge for parking.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was a movie star!!”
Reviews.Author: amberwaits
Reviews.Content: I loved the pool and hot tub. It was right on the beach. We had just a glass wall between the the sand and sea. People would walk by and be so jealous giggle!! It was close to the pier and very romantic places to eat!! LOVED the hotel very nice rooms and wonderful staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shurtliffp
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay! Staff was more than helpful! Hotel has a beautiful location, just walk out on to the beach. Incredible view! I would recommend Blue Sea lodge to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “First Impression Changed by Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: Xorreaux
Reviews.Content: I'm generally not that picky about rooms when I travel by myself. To me, on this trip being within visual distance of the ocean was more important than the room and amenities. My only request I made through the Wyndam Rewards website was not to put me on the first floor. I arrived an hour before check in time, and the front desk hostess promptly checked me in anyway. I was put on the first floor, Room 106. I was surprised that this room was even available given that the room across from me was partially demolished, the lower half of the walls in the hallway had drywall removed, with exposed studs, and the carpet in the hall and up to my door was covered with cardboard duct-taped to the walls and threshold. My balcony/patio opened up to a lovely ground level view of the parking lot. I was pretty much in disbelief at the whole situation. I approached the hostess (Melissa I think), and asked for a different room. She was very accommodating and immediately found an upper level room (352) which was an upgrade for me at no additional cost. She saved the day. The rest of the staff were uniformly friendly and personable, including housekeeping. The "partial view" rooms are exactly that. I was able to watch the sunset and see the ocean waves by sitting catty-corner on my balcony and looking between the buildings. The tropical decor wasn't something I'd choose (the inside chairs were stiff and uncomfortable, there were 2 paintings of the same thing), but there were little things that I could really appreciate (Oxygenics shower head with outstanding pressure, bottle opener in the bathroom, extra pillows, bottled water, ironing board, plenty of hand towels, decent coffee). There were a few minor annoyances (roof construction next door, the door lock wasn't responsive, the TV remote buttons were sticky) but it was a quiet, spacious, and comfortable room. The pool was a little crowded and felt a bit enclosed due to the glass windbreaks but appeared well maintained. Parking was $15/day. There is an excellent and popular beachfront restaurant (World Famous) across the parking lot with very reasonable prices that I ate breakfast at twice. The boardwalk spans several miles back and forth and gave me about an hour of brisk exercise daily, the sunsets were stunning, Mission Beach was clean, and there are plenty of convenience stores and restaurants nearby. I would stay at this hotel again but probably not for a special event like an anniversary. I felt like all the provisions I needed were there, it was weathered but clean, and the staff warmed the place up. Overall a nice, hassle-free experience and I enjoyed myself.

Reviews.Title: “Another great time in SD”
Reviews.Author: Oh_No_Will_Robinson
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit to Pacific Beach San Diego in the last ten years. Stayed at this hotel each time. This is a great place to stay; not fancy but can't beat the location and the friendly helpful staff. If you like beach and boardwalk this is it. Great local dining and shopping, sun and surf. Seem like the hotel is being well cared for as the room we stayed in was fresh and appeared fairly new. The pool and hot tub are terrific especially after a swim in the ocean. Lots to do, local bike rentals, walking, surf board rentals and did I say sun. Close to San Diego just a short drive to Old Town, airport, Gas Lamp district, Point Loma and La Jolla a great base of operations for lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and Run Down”
Reviews.Author: arianatravel
Reviews.Content: Very expensive for what you are getting! It is beach front, which is great; but the beach and the board walk is so dirty! The pool and hot tub are good and the kids enjoyed their time there. The hotel is extremely old and run down. The rooms are OK and the staff is doing everything possible to please you. There is a fee for parking and there is no complimentary breakfast. I used my Best Western Rewards for my stay, but had I paid for the room I would have cried! It is just too expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: catlo
Reviews.Content: First trip to San Diego. You cannot beat the location - ocean front right at the Mission Beach board walk. Everything is a walking distance away - restaurants, stores, even the Belmont Park. It's centrally located, so we were able to drive to the must see destinations (Sea World, San Diego Zoo, Midway, LegoLand, etc.). They have a heated pool overlooking the beach. And the rooms are so roomy with all the extra ammenities (fridge, microwave). We had a wonderful time staying here for a week - will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Clean but tired”
Reviews.Author: travelgurrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here October 15-17 2010 and found the rooms to be clean but needing renovations. Our patio door didn't close properly, the screen door fell out and the A/C leaked water on the floor all night and made noises. With the A/C, we had to be creative to get rid of the annoying "drip, drip, drip" noise so we used the ironing board and a towel to act as a deflector to stop the dripping noise. (LOL!) Thankfully, there were no bed bugs- we checked everywhere! The bedding and towels were fine, no complaints there. On the upside, the hotel is in a great location if you want to be close to the beach because it is on the water. It was also 10 minutes from everywhere: airport, Sea World, downtown, etc. I don't think I would stay there again. (If I was a surfer, maybe)

Reviews.Title: “Best Value on Mission Beach”
Reviews.Author: mlbogey
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to San Diego and our second stay at the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge. We had an ocean-view room each visit, once on the ground floor and once on the top (third floor). We loved seeing and hearing the ocean, watching the surfers any time of day and people-watching in the mornings and evenings as people went by on the boardwalk. Our favorite place to eat is right across the street; you can't beat the World Famous restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The restaurant even allowed me to order from the kids' menu! We enjoyed long walks along the boardwalk and spent one day playing in the surf after renting wetsuits and boogie boards from a local surf shack. We also enjoyed riding rented Segways on the boardwalk, along Mission Bay and in the nearby park. Everything we wanted to do for relaxation and fun is within walking distance of this hotel. Our room was great; large, with a microwave and refrigerator (handy for World Famous leftovers).
