We enjoyed grabbing lattes and bagels from the cafe in the early mornings and made sure to check at the front desk each afternoon for complimentary chocolate chip cookies. The free Wi-Fi service was a boon for our daughter's iTouch and my husband's laptop. We used the hot tub every day and swam in the pool as well. Both are well-situated right on the boardwalk! We are planning our next visit next month and will stay at the Best Western again.

Reviews.Title: “I'll keep returning to Blue Sea Lodge”
Reviews.Author: llennard
Reviews.Content: What a marvellous stay at Blue Sea Lodge Pacific Beach AGAIN. Frankie and Melissa you are absolute gems worth double your pay, no matter what my query it was attended to. At check in Melissa could not do more than give me so room choices and yes a partial ocean view really good rate and it was like home away from home. The only negative is the noise from other hotel guests in the lobby. Now the pool towels are still like nappies so please spend some $$$ on adult size pool towels. The Hotel does need some TLC but overall it is clean and a really great place to hang your beach towel. The sand of Pacific Beach is a few steps from the hotel pool and the sights along the promenade well what can one say FANTASTIC. Local restaurants in abundance World Famous opposite Blue Sea Lodge, Gringoes a few blocks walk with margaritas to die for. Local bus at the hotel door so easy travel to Old Town, Downtown San Diego as well as Balboa Park. If you want to stock up on your own essentials Ralphs supermarket a few blocks walk. Local shopping along Garnet St is retail therapy heaven especially Panagaea Outpost. Thank you for another great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super Great Stay at Blue Sea Lodge”
Reviews.Author: otempleton
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time at teh Blue Sea Lodge. The location is perfect for the entire family. Enough action for the kids and adults and just the right mix of also the ability to get away from the boradwalk. The room was clean and the pool area was nice. We will definately go again! The manager, Jason Templer, was very helpful and nice. I think it was our BEST experience in SanDiego and we have been going for many years!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location, Great Service, Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Guitraveler_617
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed for our 20th anniversary, and we received excellent service and had a great time. Our room was comfortable, and perfect for viewing the beach, the sunset, people-watching etc.. The best thing about the location was the short walk to great restaurants, the beach, a great view of the ocean from the pool/spa, Mission Bay, a grocery store, etc. I highly recommend staying at the Blue Sea whether traveling for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: seasay
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great stay at the Blue Sea Lodge. Always wanted to try it and do not regret it. Very nice rooms, awesome location, very helpful staff. Check in and out was easy. Heck, we arrived a few hours early and they even had our room ready. Perfect since our kids wanted to get out into the surf as quick as possible. Also, you got to love the pool that looks out over the beach. Only thing I did not like was that our bottom floor room seemed very vulnerable so halfway through our stay I inquired about a room higher up. No problem. We got to check out a room on the third floor and were able to move, at no extra cost, that very morning. Finally, the little cafe in the lobby is great. They surprised us by serving a huge breakfast at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: TheArteagas
Reviews.Content: This was such GREAT place to stay!! It is a Best Western so do not expect super luxury, but it is comfortable and in a FANTASTIC location. You park your car and walk to wherever you want to go! Wonderful restaurants all along the boardwalk. Only about 10 minutes from the Zoo. My husband and I went for the weekend of August 20-22 for our Anniversary, they gave us a great deal on an Ocean Front King room and upon check in they handed us a gift of champagne and flutes with a very sweet card. They really made us feel special and it got our weekend off on a great start! The rooms are not huge but have great accomodations, microwave, fridge and coffee maker. Beds are comfy with a soft mattress topper, great flat screen TV and rooms are very clean. The view is the best, I highly recommend getting a ocean front room, we left the sliding door open at night, the sound of the waves was so loud it drowned out the noise of the boardwalk. The boardwalk below can get a little loud, but it did not bother us at all. There were a few people walking on the boardwalk talking but nothing that ever woke us or prevented us from falling asleep. The pool is another great spot. My husband and I loved laying by the pool and watching the boardwalk, the pool sits on the boardwalk with a wonderful view of the beach and great people watching. A quick side note: the beach directly in front of the hotel is for surfers and is designated by flags. If you walk about 100 yards down the sand that beach is for swimmers. We did not get in the water but had a great time watching the surf lessons. This was a great spot for a wonderful weekend getaway. Truly Fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: reelcurlz
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in San Diego many times; it's just down the coast from us. We were a bit nervous about the location as we're quite past the party atmosphere that PB is known for. It was surprisingly quiet and perfect for couples or families. The staff was very unobtrusive, but the place was run smoothly. Prompt cleaning service, and staff was quick to address an internet connectivity issue. The sound of the surf disguised any noise there might have been. We always love having the beach a few steps away. The place is far from new, but appears recently remodeled. We are by no means "hotel snobs" but are fairly picky and would not hesitate to return. One negative note, however. Though the room was vacuumed daily, and the carpet appeared clean, it was not. We wore socks or sandals while in the room to keep our feet from turning an unpleasant shade of dark gray! I'm quite sure the management will quickly rectify this situation.

Reviews.Title: “Once again they have proven themselves as a superb team.”
Reviews.Author: DeniArcata
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 years in a row. In every one of my experiences here, the Manager excels in Customer Service and kindness. The front desk team reflects trickle down excellence from the management. I especially want to mention Vidi at the front desk and Juan in maintenance. They both are the type of individuals that go above and beyond the call of duty. I look forward to each time I can return to this wonderful restful, joyous experience. It is truly like coming home to loved ones for me. Sincerely, D

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Excellent Accommodations for teenagers, and young adults.”
Reviews.Author: mhalbi
Reviews.Content: Nothing is more welcoming than a smile greeting you at the front desk, and the smell of freshly baked cookies to welcome you to the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge. The teenagers loved having the beach at their front door, and Mom loved looking at the beach by the pool. Everything was walking distance, and the staff was very friendly. The room was clean, and the beds were pretty comfortable..

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: designerladyTucson
Reviews.Content: This hotel never fails to please. We have stayed here before for the location right on Pacific Beach, plus great dining close by. The manager went over and above to make our extended stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Time02
Reviews.Content: Blue Sea Lodge is a yearly stop for us. Located right on Pacific Beach, within walking distance for shopping, rentals of bikes, roller blades or surf boards and dining options. If you are looking for a place to stay with the ocean as your back yard, this is the place. The rooms have a microwave and refrigerator, and the wifi connection works very well. The front desk staff is always helpful and pleasant, regardless of the time of day or night. The housekeeping staff makes sure the rooms are well stocked and clean. They are very responsive to any special requests. You have a choice of an ocean front or ocean view room, we would recommend the ocean front.

Reviews.Title: “Our twenty-fifth year at Blue Sea Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Minnie040
Reviews.Content: Every summer our family has a reunion at the Blue Sea Lodge. We just had our 25th year there and we are already looking forward to next year. We are a large group and the staff makes sure that we have the accommodations that we request. Our ages range from babies to 70. This hotel and the surrounding area appeals to everyone. We have found that everyone at the Blue Sea Lodge is pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Always amazing”
Reviews.Author: bumblzee
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every year...and love it. The staff is always very friendly and everything is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: BigSky_59808
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location. We love the beach and the little kids love the pool. Everything is walking distance (Pier, Konos, Roller Coaster, Fast Food, Shops etc). I plan to go back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: flybygracie
Reviews.Content: We have been coming here to San Diego for 25 years and have stayed at the same hotel. Cannot beat the location. We have little children and the convenience of the beach being literally footsteps away from your hotel is irreplaceable. Good food and shopping nearby as well as many activities. Staff are great and service as well. Although rooms are a bit on the small side we will be back next year and the year after. My daughters are already talking about next year trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service, nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: julesinaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge as I heard good reviews of this property and knew it was right on Pacific Beach. I was pleasantly suprised when arriving to see how close they were to not only the beach, but Garnett STreet also (the street where lots of restaurants, shops, gift stores are located - just a few blocks away.) There is also plenty of bike rental shops nearby and a bead store in the plaza next door where people can make thier own jewely (a nice activity to do if traveling with teen girls or looking for somethign indoors if the weather isn't ideal.) The room we stayed in was in the same building at the main lobby and it was extremly nice and spacious with a patio and partial ocean view which was perfect. Front desk staff was very friendly - espeically Luis! I would highly recommend this property to anyone looking to stay at the beach and enjoy the weekend in San Diego! It was nice to not need a rental car and be close to plenty to do.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunfly760
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and the hotel and staff were absolutly fantastic! The General Manager, Reuben, was very accomodating and we plan on going back for a longer stay. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great stay in an awesome location!

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Denvercrazy
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful experience at the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge. Location. location.location. View of the ocean was incredible and it was very nice to leave the hotel property and step into the sand of Mission Beach. We parked the car on Saturday and didn move it until check out on Tuesday. Plenty of resturantes and family things to do within walking distance of the hotel. The staff was very accomdating and super friendly. Rooms were clean and hotel in general was kept up nicely. Thank you from the Clark family room 373

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: beachgirlCalgary
Reviews.Content: We loved the pool area with glass wall looking right onto the strand.....great people watching! The front desk staff were awesome....especially Luis & Frankie! Rooms were ok.... a little small...good for 2 people...not more...Bathroom could be alot bigger too. The location is so great, right at the start of Pacific Beach. We would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: COgirlinCA
Reviews.Content: We originally booked this hotel only because it was the best price for staying right on the beach. I ended up loving it!! We had a partial view of the beach, and it was actually a great view! The standard rooms have balconies and a small refrigerator. It was really clean, and the staff extremely courteous and helpful! If you don't like to get in the ocean, but still like to swim with an ocean view, the pool area faces the beach! It is in an awesome area of Mission Beach, and it's within walking distance of the Pacific beach area, which has numerous restaurants and shopping.The restaurant right across the parking lot from the hotel, World Famous, is amazing also! This hotel was right in the middle of it all! The only not so great thing was that it gets kind of noisy right outside of your room (especially in the morning), and the sliding glass door to the patio was really hard to close. If you're going to San Diego for a beach vacation, this hotel is where it's at for a fantastic experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect for a beach getaway!”
Reviews.Author: kbirvin
Reviews.Content: Great experience, very pleasant staff, Jason Templer (manager), very helpful, willing to address any concerns. Our family will return to the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst, but too many other options to stay again”
Reviews.Author: azsoftballmom1
Reviews.Content: The location of the lodge is very good and staff at the hotel are as accommodating as they can be. Unfortunately, the rooms are incredibly small. We had a room with 2 queen beds and the dresser made it so that only 1 person at a time could walk by the beds. I requested an upgrade, however, due to the holiday weekend it was not available. As we walked the boardwalk, I realized that there are so many other options that are comparable in price and seem to have much larger rooms. The beds were comfortable and the hotel was clean, but next time, I will finds something that is more suitable for a family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lazynights
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable rooms, great ocean views, excellent location, free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay !!”
Reviews.Author: cb1062
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Blue Sea Lodge, and it won't be my last. The location, right on the boardwalk overlooking the beach and the Pacific Ocean, is fantastic. Last time we had an oceanfront room, but this time we decided on a pool view room. My daughter and her friend (20 & 21) loved that we were give a first floor room and we were able to walk right out to the pool. No problem getting lounge chairs and the pool was nice and warm. We had two queen beds for the three of us and the size of the room was great. There is a small sink, fridge, and microwave in the room. We walked two blocks to Ralphs and bought some drinks and snacks to keep in the room. One of our greatest finds was the Pita Pit. We'd walk up 4 blocks or so and eat lunch there. Loved it. We also ate at Joe's Crab shack (yummy crab legs) and the Ale House. Both are on the boardwalk, a couple of blocks away. The hotel is located in a great location on the boardwalk. Close to places to eat and fantastic views. This is a great hotel for families with kids. The staff at the hotel make your stay very enjoyable. If you need anything, just ask. They are very accommodating. Special thanks to Jen at the front desk for going above and beyond helping me to print my boarding passes when I was having difficulties. Can't wait for our next trip to San Diego and the Blue Sea Lodge !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Iceman1964_10
Reviews.Content: I went on a business trip and had an excellent stay at the Blue Sea, I have been to MANY hotels all over the north western and south western united states and only had one stay that was as good as this one. The rooms were nice and clean, the beds were comfortable, and the shower/bath was huge and clean. I enjoyed sitting out on the balcony and having coffee in the morning as well as relaxing after work in the evening. It has been years since I have been able to go for an evening swim in the ocean (the pool looked nice but I like the sea) also it is close to lots of good places to eat within walking distance and last but certainly not least, the staff was very accomodating and frendly and when I had a problem with registering on line (my fault) the magement went out of there way to fix things to my satisfaction and these days that is truely rare. Since I stayed there I have made many bookings there for colleagues and they have always returned more than satisfied. When I go to San Diego I only stay at Best Western Blue Sea, and for the price you can not go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: goathill63
Reviews.Content: The only thing good that I can mention is the view and location. When checking in late evening, there was no one at the desk and I had to call for someone several times. This person was flat and not very welcoming. He offered no information about the facility unless I asked. We had to lug 4 large pieces of luggage up a flight of stairs to get to the elevator, so that we can get to the second floor. The rooms are across the alley from the lobby. Way overpriced, even if it is right on the beach. For the price, parking should be included. The Beach front was full of Seaweeds, not sure if anything could be done about that. Now comes the real issues. At night there is an entrance door that is always slamming. Loudly. The hottub smelled like someone was getting a perm. The room description claims that the rooms are spacious, however our room was not. It was very cramped. The tub was not clean and the nonslip strips were coming undone. During the whole time that we were there, I didn't dare take a bath or let my 5 year old take one, so he had to have his first showers and was not to happy. I crossed the alley to seek help with parking on my last night there and there was no one there. The lights were out and the phone was ringing. The night before, I needed change for the laundry, had to wait until someone showed up. Then turns out that change was not available. I will not stay there again. Oh, and we had dinner at the restaurant across the parking lot. Was excellent, however, my daughter and I got diarhhea later...think it was the clam chowder. Beds were comfortable When I came back to work and asked where I lodged, I was embarrased to even mention this place. I brought this to the attention of the manager and he gave me $50 off, for a three night stay bill of over $600.00.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Relaxing Accomidation and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: maggie927
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived I was a bit turned off that the facility did not have a resturant or lounge...But I soon Forgave them because there were so many other amenities to make up for the Missing "On Site Food !" The Hotel was Clean ..Friendly ...and the veiw was more than I hoped for ! I watched the locals ride bikes ...surf in the Ocean ...and just enjoy the surrooundings There are great resturants right across the street ..Tony Roma as well as numerous palces to eat long the stretch of beach..and a Starbucks two blocks over !!! You can easily walk to the local entertainment areas and not worry about having a few drinks ...becasue you can safley walk back to your hotel ! The staff and the manager were extxremly friendly and accomidating ...and they happily provide you with written directions to where ever you need to go . There is local transportation (Bus) about three blocks away which you can take up to La Jolla to see the Sea Lions and Beached Seals at Childrens Pool. I also visited teh San Diego Zoo ...about a 20 minute car ride (Taxis are waiting outside the hotel almost constantly ..so No wiating ) The Zoo was awesome !! I also took a 25 minute ride to Historical San Diego Gas Light area ...and that was amazing !!! Great resturants ...The Padres Home Field ..Hard Rock Cafe ...I would definitley recommend this Best Western ,....YOu will have a Fabulous Visit !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Front Hotel Makes It A Tropical Californian Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: DestinySierra00
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! Everything was so clean and neat. The staff were so knowledgeable and friendly. The location is perfect. It is affordable and so perfect! It is comfortable and spacious. We had the best vacation ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - awesome location”
Reviews.Author: shoegirl011
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the blue sea lodge at the end of April. We were upgraded to an ocean view room which was a bit crowded for us (2 adults, 2 kids, and 5 suitcases) but we made it work. The location was unbeatable, right on the beach. Although it was too cold outside to use, the pool area was always clean. Lots of nearby restaraunts and close to major attractions like SeaWorld. They do have a small cafe on site that's only open in the a.m. with simple breakfast things like bagels, muffins, yogurt, fresh fruit, and cereal. They can also made breakfast sandwiches. You could prepurchase breakfast when booking the hotel online for $7/person/day but we found it less expensive to just buy the stuff we wanted. The one night there were some late night partiers on the beach which woke my husband up so I would think during "beach season" that noise would be bothersome but as we were travelling during low season it wasn't a real issue. The underground parkade was nice to have since we had a rental. They had free wireless but it was flaky at times. This hotel is nothing fancy, pretty basic, but you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Disappointing - do your research before you stay here”
Reviews.Author: connie1968
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. The area in general is pretty run down. This is an area with heavy traffic for young people on the party scene. It might be good to visit but don't bother staying overnight unless you can find a high end condo for rent in the nicer part of town. Services are pretty limited - not ideal for families with young children. The hotel is old. The best thing this hotel had to offer was the view and access to the ocean. But at the prices they charge, it is totally not worth it. The carpet in our room was old and dirty. The air conditioning was smelly and annoying. There was no table/chairs in the room. We ended up having to sit on the bed. The barstools/bench were a joke. In our room one bed was inches away from the bathroom. We were suppose to stay for 3 nights, my husband couldn't stand it, he found a different hotel for a comparable price with much more to offer. The restaurant we were told is privately operated - not what their web site indicates. Maybe we just got an old bad room. The hotel staff were nice at least. In San Diego there are better values! I will not stay here again or recommend it. You can't expect much from a Best Western, but this was pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service - a real gem for our travelling team.”
Reviews.Author: Baseballparent33116
Reviews.Content: When we first started looking for hotels for our school's baseball team, we were thinking the Blue Sea Lodge (Best Western) might be out of our price range. The staff at the Blue Sea Lodge, however, were able to give us a rate that turned out to be well worth it. The hotel is located right on the "boardwalk" and within walking distance of a large variety of restaurants (from fast food to fancy), as well as a supermaket and pharmacy. The rooms were clean and comfortable, with each one having a balcony view (even if just a sliver) of the water. The staff -- both front desk and management -- were fantastic! Very friendly and helpful, and willing to give out coupons for discounts or preferred service at a number of restaurants. Lowell's baseball players said it was the "best" place they've stayed at so far!

Reviews.Title: “A favorite place to go to watch the sunsets and listen to the surf!”
Reviews.Author: susanne008
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Blue Sea Lodge for the last couple years. The staff are always friendly and if they said they will honor a request, we have been able to count on it ! Be prepared to pay extra for parking but really liked the handy, off street parking in the hotel's basement garage. The rooms are older but very comfortable with an area with a small table and chairs for morning coffee. We really appreciate how clean the rooms are and the maid service is just the best. Always happy to return to our room, beds made, bathroom clean and restocked with plenty of towels. We even had a little kitchen area this time with sink, counter space and storage.( With a Ralph's Grocery right down the street it is really handy to pick up snacks or things we have forgotten to bring) We really enjoy the ocean views and sound of the waves from our balcony facing the pool! Doesn't get much better than walking from our hotel across the pool area and onto the beach! (And really like the security of using our key card to reenter the pool area from the beach) Been awakened by loud talking from the pool area at night a few times but figured it was "Spring Break" and we still like the poolside room location. We enjoy the great restuarants within walking distance, anything from fresh fish, BBQ ribs, pizza, sandwiches, just about anything. We rented bikes just down the street (found prices varied from shop to shop) and enjoyed riding on nice wide sidewalks around the beautiful bay just a couple minutes bike ride from the hotel. Lots of things to do and not enough vacation time to do it all in....Maybe next year.....

Reviews.Title: “Blue Sea Lodge was a perfect romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: CarlsbadCouple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Blue Sea for our anniversary getaway, and had a great time. The view was wonderful, looking directly out on Pacific Beach and the boardwalk, and we could hear the ocean and sit on the balcony and drink our coffee. The room had a nice king-size bed too. The common area had a good jacuzzi and pool. Everything was clean and neat. We walked to a nearby restaurant for our evening dinner, and there were breakfast places all along the boardwalk.. The staff was pleasant and helpful (..even took our picture for us!). We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Ocean View on the beach - Nice Hotel - Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: gaper1
Reviews.Content: Right on the beach in an area known for it's surf.. this hotel is basic, very clean with a wonderfully helpful staff. The decor is dated, the view - timeless. We slept to the sound of the Pacific surf and in the am enjoyed our coffee as we sat on our balcony and watched the surfers and beach joggers. We travelled to many areas of San Diego and found this hotel area to be safe and conveniently located, The front desk was well staffed and personnel were very pleasant and ready to be of assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: Finngal2
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Blue Sea Lodge in San Diego in February with my travel group. We were all going on a Carnival cruise out of San Diego and decided to have a pre-cruise function for 2 nights prior to the cruise. The BW Blue Sea Lodge was a great place for our party. The location is beautiful and right on the beach. Restaurants, shops, spas and all the conveniences are right at your door step. The rooms have all been updated and are spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful too!

Reviews.Title: “I can hear the ocean all nite and great support from staff”
Reviews.Author: birthroot1
Reviews.Content: I was so pleased to really be right on the ocean, the town car was waiting for me at the airport even tho my arrival was very early, they had a room ready for me, knowing I was coming so early and not making me have to store all my luggage behind the front desk until 12 noon was surprisingly thoughtful. I found out after I arrived at the lobby that there was supposed to be a fee associated with the car ride but it was waived when I'm sure I looked surprised and mentioned that the free shuttle service was one of the reasons I choose the hotel. I was ready to pay, but the person in charge that day said it would be taken care of and wanted to know which website I had booked with. Today, I had a computer crisis, one that started last night. Melissa, is the nite clerk, and she is so helpful and happy to be helpful. she really deserves a raise, as she helped me last night with computer stuff--not even in her job description I'm sure, but was so kind, made some phone calls to get more advce, etc. She made me feel as if nothing was too much trouble. And the computer got up and running. We decided to just leave it on... No luck with that, so this morning down to the front desk I go and I'm told the Radio Shack isn't too far and they are willing to look at it. Well, it was quite a walk, but I got there only to find I would be purchasing a new laptop at Staples across the street. I stop at Ralph's (local grocery store that is very close 4-5 blocks, 10 minute walk/stroll and this is great as your room has a fridge, sink and microwave) on the way back and consider buying my own bottle of tequila... As I stroll in to the lobby I menton that that was quite a jaunt you sent me on, all three woman behind the counter had dropped jaws and truly surprised looks. They thought I had a car! I was offered a taxi when I needed to go back and pick up my new down-loaded computer. I asked the ball-park cost of that and the manager, Catherine B. spoke right up and said she would be happy to drive me over when the store called back. How nice is that I ask you? She piped right up and said her job was to help me enjoy my stay, all aspects of my stay. I have to say that between Melissa and Catherine, I could have had a bad association with my stay here, but I only have great things to say about the location, the friendly (over used I know, but really, happy friendliness, not the kind that you know 'it's just their job to act like they care) assistance with a problem that was really none of their responsibility makes me want this hotel to continue to be a success and popular. The boardwalk is right off the pool area and there are plenty of local places to eat within a five minute walk, bike rentals, surf board rentals, lots to do and a few touristy shops as well; T-shirts, beach chairs, etc. The pirce for this great stay was so very reasonable--I thought I could never afford to stay 'on the beach', but this hotel did exactly that. Don't hesitate to book your stay here. Thanks again to Melissa and Manager Catherine B.--you both deserve a raise, as Ihave no doubt you treat everyone this well all the time.

Reviews.Title: “A conveniently located beachfront hotel with a wide variety of dining & entertainment nearby to ensure a pleasant trip.”
Reviews.Author: MolemanBremerton_WA
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been personally utilized for business and personal travel for many years. The location is absolutely ideal for easy walking distance access to the beach, fine or casual dining and a wide variety of entertainment in the area. The hotel easily fulfills the needs of the business traveler, as well as, those families with children or adults seeking an enjoyable, relaxing vacation. The management and entire staff are very friendly, knowledgeable and willing to accommodate all of the traveler's needs. Their keen recognition of those common needs and desire to satisfy makes them a facility you'll want to utilize on every trip to the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “A Gamble”
Reviews.Author: ADG_NJ
Reviews.Content: Our stay started out bad and end good. Its a gamble on getting a decent room here. Our first night we were put in a room on the first floor and close to the "boardwalk" quotes on board because its concrete. Anyway we dropped our bags and went out for the night, didn't really inspect the room, so when we got back i quickly realized the AC was broke, the lock on the patio door was broken and the microwave didn't work. It was late and wasn't that hot so we decide to open the door and deal with it in the morning. Unfortunately through out the night, drunks would be hoping through our patio trying to get to the beach, a little unsettling to wake up in the middle of the night and see someone stumbling through your patio. Next morning i complained about these things and they sent some one to replace the microwave and look at the AC. They could not fix the AC and the door was still broken. I asked to be moved at this point, honestly i shouldn't have had to ask with some many things going wrong. Here comes the good, They gave me a choice of two rooms one being an ocean front room on the second floor with a flat screen tv and a great view, I quickly took that one, they didn't charge me for the upgrade and the rest of the stay was great. People watching on the boardwalk is wonderful. Parking is really safe as well, its in a gated underground parking garage so I felt the car was safe. If you are staying here DO NOT STAY ON GROUND FLOOR. Ocean view rooms are great. Price and location are good as well, many other hotels on the beach front cost much more. Its a short walk to a lot of the nightlife and plenty of restaurants near by. One last thing, the pool and hot tub are not clean at all. Pool was filled with sand and the hot tub had bird droppings and hair in it. Kinda Gross!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the beach - great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeMom10
Reviews.Content: We finished our family California vacation in San Diego with two rooms at the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge. The rooms were clean and well laid out with a fridge, coffee maker (with an excellent local Santa Barbara blend of coffee) and microwave. The beach is steps away and the pool area with lounge chairs right at the boardwalk was very nice. Pacific Beach was a perfect location for our San Diego trip, close to Sea World and the downtown area. The front desk staff was very helpful. We enjoyed our stay and would return when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “No hidden charges, wonderful front desk personnel”
Reviews.Author: waveMI
Reviews.Content: Was searching for ocean front accomodation for my visit to SD. No help with my timeshare. Lots of options within walking distance to beach, but I needed to "hear" it, and I could, even with a partial view room. Included microwave, small fridge, coffeepot, kitchen sink, free wifi - but bring some plastic utensils.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: frankhurtte
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Blue Sea Lodge is located right in the center of things in Pacific Beach. It's location is right on the beach. While many will find the rooms small and the hotel a bit tired, the location makes it all worth while. October is on the shoulder of the season. The weather is nice - warm enough for sun and fun in the daytime and cool evenings. And, it never rains this time of year. The boardwalk in Pacific, Mission Beach goes on for 3-4 miles and offers some of the best bars, restaurants and all around cool vibe. I recommend you rent a bike and experience the area first hand.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RosslynUSA
Reviews.Content: This was a good place to stay. Our room was spacious, very clean, very large closet with a great patio. You could see a bit of the ocean from it. The front desk was super helpful, providing car directions and other suggestions. The hot tub was great and the kids tolerated the pool. But the pool was advertised as "heated" and I was unable to get in because the water was so cold. I could see the kids shivering and teeth chattering. I have a 5 and 8 year old. If they would turn up the heat on the pool, it would be the perfect place. I was unaware of the $14/day parking fee. Another great thing is that you can see the boardwalk, the beach and the ocean from the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: H8_the_cold
Reviews.Content: We were here only for 2 nights. Their website implies that this is a more upscale hotel than it really is (...recently renovated...bath robes...microwaves...free internet access). May have been recently renovated, but the carpeting in our room was stained, there were no bath robes, no microwave and the internet access was not usable - we kept losing the connection. The shower was extremely slow draining. We told the front desk about this problem on our way out the first day and were told they would take care of it. That night when my daughter showered the tub was half full by the time she was done. It did not appear that they did anything about it. When we checked out we mentioned it again (just to let them know) and they appologized and gave us a $50 gift card good for our next visit. They seem to have a ready supply of these for those who are not pleased with the hotel. Now on the plus side - the location is great. The hotel is located right on the boardwalk in Pacific Beach. Parking is included with the room and there are many good restaurants within walking distance. So I guess it all depends what you are looking for Luxury or a great location at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky - not non Smoking”
Reviews.Author: familyvacation10000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK The staff are friendly. However, they advertise as a non-smoking hotel and the hallways and pool are smoky. In fact, with the glass enclosure around the pool it retains the cigarette smoke and you can't breathe. We had to go to the beach to get away from the smell. As well, a large group of at least 15 young people in their late 20's spent the day at the pool smoking and drinking all day and night. By night they were quite drunk and the smoke was so intense that I couldn't even go on our balcony and we were on the third floor. So, unless they change their smoking policy we won't be back. Apparently, it is fine for them to smoke and drink at the pool all day. There were cigarette butts under the spray shower that you use upon returning from the beach - quite gross. Also they were out of pool towels. They need one more internet site at the office as it is lined up all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: katie1234
Reviews.Content: We liked this place - it's a good affordable option in Pacific Beach Pros: Great location right on the beach. Easy Parking ($12/night) Clean - I even saw housekeeping washing the comforters (I am never sure if hotels do that) We had an ocean view queen and we had a great view of the ocean - we were in room 231. Free wireless Internet Pacific Beach is convenient for seeing the sights in San Diego. Cons: The furnishings were a bit outdated and the common hallways could use an update. Noise - we could hear people in other rooms (mostly the doors opening and closing) so the rooms could be better soundproofed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: rbr0wn
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right on the beach! We had a full ocean view and were able to sleep with the sliding door open so we could hear the sound of the surf all night. Location is so convenient - right near the freeway so easy access to other sights and the airport. Tony Roma's is right across the street. Room was very spacious and had a refrigerator and microwave. Balcony was fairly large (compared to most places) and was a terrific spot to enjoy morning coffee. We didn't use them, but our room was just a few steps away from the pool and hot tub. There was also free wireless in the room and it worked well. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Usual Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: DeniArcata
Reviews.Content: I have written before regarding this location. I also feel it is important to recognize great service each time we experience it. Per typical, of my stay here everyone is so helpful, thoughtful and make my time here so pleasant. Rubin the manager has certainly proven to be a top leader. Having been a highly recognized customer service account manager myself with many awards (from a large well known corporation), I know that this type of great attitude from employees this a trickle down attitude from the top. Everyone from the maintainence man to the front desk are so kind, nice and upbeat. They make me feel at home which is very important to me, having to travel to San Diego so far from home and take care of necessary business frequently. It is comforting to know I have a place to go to that is so inviting. I now look forward to making this trip, which before discovering the Blue Sea Lodge, was grulling and troubling. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay, but cannot get the same rates anymore”
Reviews.Author: badbarn9
Reviews.Content: I hate to spent more than $100 for a hotel, but booked this with a patial view as a retirement present at an average of about $140 for 6 nights. They gave me a great room with a great view (instead of a patial), looking over the pool and ocean. Hotel is old and somewhat noisy, but I enjoyed my stay. I tried to rebook 4 times now, but cannot get myself to spent over $150 for an old hotel. Average quality room and no benies. As a matter of fact, they closed the hot tub for repair on night 4. Just don't think it is worth much more than $100

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Spot! :D”
Reviews.Author: pigg1961
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed here in late May, 2009, for our honeymoon in San Diego. Being in the Pacific Beach area, there were some partiers around, but nothing disturbing. Management and hotel employees made sure order was maintained. Blue Sea Lodge was right across the boardwalk from the beach and within walking distance of Yogurtland - a favorite of ours, as well as grocery stores, restaurants, shops, etc. Parking was manageable (we recommend a smaller car, esp if you have a choice of rentals). Breakfast wasn't self-serve, so it took a little longer to get in and out, esp. if you had big days of sightseeing ahead. We were kind of wondering why it wasn't set up as self-serve, as it would have been more convenient for guests, I would think. It was okay, but nothing to write home about. The bagel sandwiches were fine. It was handy having a fridge and microwave in the room, as many of the evening meals were so plentiful that near the end of our stay we had at least two nights' worth of leftovers to consume. One of the best things was having the sliding glass door open at any time of day or night and being able to hear the waves washing up on the beach...very relaxing and romantic! :)

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Location in a Motel Room”
Reviews.Author: LuvSHOes
Reviews.Content: Our family with young children stayed at this motel for two nights during the week before Labor Day weekend. The location is absolutely phenomenal. It's literally steps from Pacific Beach. The motel pool and hot tub are directly on the boardwalk, with an incredible ocean view. There is no need to drive anywhere during your stay as everything is within walking distance--restaurants, shops, a grocery store. The pool area is nothing special, but it was clean, and had plenty of places to sit or lounge. Pool towels, although very skimpy and threadbare, are provided by the pool, which is always nice. The nearby outdoor shower is very handy after coming from the beach. Parking is on site, with the usual beach location parking fee. There is also an underground garage, which, although has very tight spaces, is a nice, secure feature. Our room was on the second floor, and had a fantastic view of the ocean. The rooms are cleverly designed with a wall-size mirror by the balcony, to give you an ocean view even when you're not facing the ocean. The rooms have a kitchenette with a mini-fridge and microwave and kitchen sink. The room was relatively clean in terms of the kitchen and bathroom area, but the carpet was horribly dirty. Our childrens' socks/feet were stained black after just minutes of walking around the room. Granted, it's a beach location, but it was very obvious that the carpet had not been cleaned in a very, very long time. Ironically, the carpet in the hallways was in the process of being cleaned while we were there, so perhaps there are plans to clean the carpet in the rooms too. The location is the best thing about this motel. And, it is a motel, plain and simple. We had lower expectations, so we weren't disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect beach hotel for So-Cal people watching and a clean room!”
Reviews.Author: Islandheat
Reviews.Content: I checked in to the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge on Saturday, August 22nd for a three night stay. The hotel was at 100% occupancy, but check in was speedy and the staff was very friendly. I reserved a room with a king bed and partial ocean view and got just that. My room overlooked the pool and I could see a slice of Mission Beach. I had one complaint - the location of my room next the elevator. I want to tell you how they turned a not very serious problem into a wonderful experience. I'm a light sleeper and I could hear the frequently used elevator. Please note that this was a Saturday night during the peak of the season and late night guests coming and going should be expected. I mentioned my trouble sleeping to a manager (Kathy) and she asked if I would like to move to a different room, which I willingly accepted. I got lucky because they gave me an upgrade to a room with an ocean front view and it made my short holiday just fantastic. I LOVE the ocean view, right over Mission Beach and the Boardwalk. I enjoyed watching the surfers, and all the people walking, skating, or peddling up and down the boardwalk. Just a tad bit up the boardwalk from the hotel is World Famous, a great place to eat with a long line of people outside waiting to get in to this popular spot. As I was relaxing on my deck one evening, I was pleasantly suprised to see street performers entertaining the crowd waiting outside World Famous. I loved my rooms. The partial ocean view king bed room has a great sunken tub/shower. I loved the brilliant white towels, the coffee maker, and a very convenient bottle opener in the bathrooms. The ocean view room was nicely appointed with an LG flat screen TV, as well as a real granite countertop and a skylight in the bath. Thanks again for a great stay. Thanks to Luis and Gabriel at the front desk and Kathy who helped make my experience at the Blue Sea Lodge a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Made myself and my clients feel at home”
Reviews.Author: terrieboberry
Reviews.Content: I'm an interior Designer from Phoenix Arizona. My project was in San Diego and over 8 weeks the staff made every effort to make my stay comfortable. The staff was friendly and worked with me to put me in a lovely oceanview room and each time put me in a similar room. The recent remodel is very nice and fresh! The Restaraunts in the immediate offered fresh fare and were convienient. The Pool area gives you the best the area has to offer. I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “So Close to the Ocean for a Best Western!”
Reviews.Author: herbieBme
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have the pleasure of staying with Best Western Blue Sea Lodge in San Diego. At first I was surprised that Best Western had a location this close to the ocean. Upon arrival I was very pleased with our room with an "Ocean View" I couldn't believe how close to the beach and ocean we were. Out the back door and into the ocean as I put it. After the day on the beach we were surprised to find how many great restaurants there were within walking distance. Everything from fast food to fine dinning. There was even a drug store and supermarket within walking distance (5 mins) We will be making reservations early to next year to make sure we can return to the location and room we enjoyed this year. Very clean motel with friendly office staff willing to go out of their way for you, not like the hotel we stayed at last year for more money and no ocean out the back door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-period”
Reviews.Author: firewife112704
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of few that is right at the beach. First room they put is in had a broken ac unit then they moved us into one w/a broken closet door & no shower curtain. It is rundown in the sense that the elevator is very old & sounds horrible. We paid over $300 per night to stay there for its location, next time I would definitely look into rental a vacation rental, there are plenty to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Subpar Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CupcakeCA
Reviews.Content: Positives- excellent beach access-comfortable bed Negatives- cards kept deactivating- patio door was in need of repair (lock wasn't very secure and the screen door didn't work well) Couldn't park in the underground parking, Expedition wouldn't fit under the sign to enter. A little pricey for the quality of the hotel. Handicap rooms aren't very handicap friendly. We were traveling with friends with a disabled child. The first room they were assigned, she couldn't move around at all with her walker. Second room (165) was better, except she couldn't get into the bathroom with her walker because of door positioning. Would be difficult for someone disabled traveling alone,

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jhedman123golf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel frequently and have never had better service than that provided at the Blue Sea Lodge in San Diego, CA. From check-in to check-out, the entire staff was extremely friendly, helpful and courteous. And the room... Wow!!! Full ocean view (right on the beach), comfortable bedding, great shower/bathroom facilities, and very privet/quiet (except for the rythmic lull of the ocean's waves as the tide rolls in and out). We came for our 24th anniversary. We left with a "honeymoon" experience. We'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: welschuler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge July 12 - 17, 2009. Check in was very smooth. The front desk staff very helpful. We did not bring a car, so parking was not an issue for us, but we could tell that they have a limited parking area, with very small spaces. The room was adequate but very clean with a nice shower and bathroom. The maid service was excellent. The free Wi-Fi was a nice touch. We had a 3rd floor ocean front room with an excellent view and nice balcony. Location really is the main attraction to this hotel. You truly can walk to many restaurants and stores. Had the best breakfast ever at the "World Famous" which is right next to the hotel. There was a grocery store within easy walking distance. Not to mention many convenience stores and shops. We took the bus downtown a couple of days. Very easy to navigate and an all day pass is only $5 per person. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes the beach, boardwalk, clean rooms (though small) and a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: almeister6
Reviews.Content: We had an oceanfront room with a balcony overlooking the boardwalk. I was surprised that I could get to the neighbors sliding glass door from my balcony. Check in and check out were quick and easy. It was a nice room with a refrigerator and microwave. The bed was comfortable and the the TV worked well. The pool and hot tub were both clean and had a very nice view of the ocean. If I go again, I will ask for a pool side room. They have easy access to the beach. Pros: Location, beach, pool, hot tub, Beso's Yogurt a minute away, location Cons: Price, there always seemed to be a huge pile of dirty linens outside our room, would be nice to have a continental breakfast, could hear the people upstairs pretty clearly.

Reviews.Title: “Beachfront Location is Great, Hotel is Average”
Reviews.Author: jctaz85
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Blue Sea Lodge a few times in the summer while vacationing with friends. The prices of the rooms are a little high, even considering location. The room itself is very average, nothing too special. However, its proximity to the boardwalk and the ocean is why I've stayed more than once. The hotel is located on Mission Beach and sits directly on the boardwalk. You are just steps from the sand and the ocean. If you follow the boardwalk toward Crystal Pier, you'll come across several souvenir shops and food stands and a bike rental shop or two. If you walk the same direction behind the hotel on Mission Boulevard, you'll also find many places to shop (Garnet Avenue) and eat. The bay is not a far walk from the hotel and is usually much quieter and peaceful if you need time away from the beach, or rent a beach crusier and ride there instead!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: vcgeno
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Pacific/Mission Beach you can't ask for a better location. You are right on the beach. We stayed over 4th of July weekend and were smack dab in the middle of all of the madness. Other then location it is just an average hotel, and without the location it would be below average. The hotel is tired and in need of repair. The hot tub when we first got there only had 1 jet working and but by the end of the stay it had about 1/3 of them working. The roof in the bathroom needed to be replaced and the shower head sprayed all over the place. We could have also used a lounge chair or two on our patio. In its favor the beds were comfortable, it had a refridgerator and microwave, and it had about the best in room coffee I have ever tasted. For what you pay it wold not kill them to offer complementary continental breakfast but other then the in room coffee there was nothing. The internet connection was fast and easy to use. So if you don't have time to rent a condo for a week, are not too fussy about the condition of the hotel, and you are looking for the best location on the beach then give this place a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value if your expectations aren't too high...”
Reviews.Author: WileEToyote
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here and have no issues recommending it for a family type vacation. The Good: - Stayed Wed-Fri nights, booked and paid for a Std Rm, was upgraded to a partial ocean without asking... nice. - got $150 discount for a 3 night stay through the Blue Sea Website only (... not on the BW Corp website) - Very comfortable beds (had two Queens in our room) - 1st floor partial ocean view rooms had a very large patio area (smaller balconies for the upper rooms) - Ample parking (which is hard to come by in that area) with their two parking lots and underground garage. - Clean rooms, grounds, and pool area. - Free WiFi worked flawlessly The not so good: - Parking spots were all compact... most large sedans/trucks spilled over to the adjacent spot (typical was 2 cars for every 3 spots). No complaints from Mgt so no issue. - TV remote didn't work so had go old school and push the buttons on the actual tv :-) - Bathroom bulb was going out... sometimes the bathroom had light, sometimes it was dim and flickery... didn't bother me enough to call for maintenance... told the front desk when i left.

Reviews.Title: “blue sea lodge is a perfect on the beach stay!!”
Reviews.Author: rlp88
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Blue Sea Lodge every year for a family vacation , Its an ideal spot right on the boardwalk and the beach is easy access. The kids can swim and hotub in the safety of the gates and still watch the ocean and all the fun people on the boardwalk .Gabriel Ramirez made our reservation and helped us get a great room and made our stay comfortable and fun!! we will definately stay there again next year.. LOOking forward to it !!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: dogfishMN
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right on the beach and boardwalk. Walking to restaurants, shopping, bars and Belmont Amusement Park. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Room and grounds were clean and well maintained. Good security. Request an outside room if you want to avoid pool noise. Only complaint is paying for parking at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A trip to treasure!”
Reviews.Author: pjandersonma
Reviews.Content: My eighty-year-old father and eighteen-year-old and I stayed in late February while visiting USD. The Blue Sea Lodge was fantastic! So much so, that I returned for a four day stay with my sixteen-year-old daughter as a reward for making it through another school year. The ocean, the view, the incredibly accommodating staff, the bike rides down the boardwalk, boogie boarding, the wonderfully comfortable rooms, all made this a perfect beginning to summer. The staff at Blue Sea do everything to anticipate their guests needs! We had (ANOTHER) incredible time! WE WILL RETURN!

Reviews.Title: “Beachfront Beauty”
Reviews.Author: Harley_Parker_Inc
Reviews.Content: I am the head of a large corporation and I stay in many hotels throughout the course of a year. Rarely Do I get to stay a my Bay-front Home in Monaco. But his hotel was quite possibly the most comfortable I have been all year.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Jessica_Lynn_Sampson
Reviews.Content: i thought my stay was very good. i enjoyed it completely. My room was also very nice, it was clean and it was a cozy feeling which i always like to feel when i stay at a hotel. Also the staff was great, they helped me with any issue i had and the rate for my room was good also. There wasnt anything i didnt like the least, just overall my stay at this hotel was very well and i cant wait to stay at it again

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel in a good location with good service”
Reviews.Author: overbuddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take short vacation pre summer and before she has our first child. We stayed 4 nights at the Blue Sea Lodge and I give this hotel a solid 3 out of 5 stars. More like a 3.5. We loved the proximity to the beach. You cross the boardwalk and you're on the beach. The pool area was easily the best aspect of the hotel. You can sit behind a clear glass barrier and enjoy the sun and watch the waves w/o being bothered much. On the other hand, the hotel wasn't as quiet as I would have liked. I'm a light sleeper and needed a sleep aid to get to sleep 3 of the nights. We has a room with a king size bed and we did not have an ocean view. It would've been nice, but it would have been too loud for me coming from the Midwest. Also, the TV we had in our room was terrible. It was noisy and old. They need to upgrade from the 20" tube to flat screens in all the rooms. We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel as we decided to not rent a car. It cost around $40 each way. An airport shuttle would've been nice as would a continental breakfast. They did have a little shop that offered a few breakfast options. We ate there one morning but would not recommend it. There are way better options a few blocks away on the beach. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. They got us on the right bus and trolley to and from downtown and helped us with other recommendations. Our room was cleaned each day and there were no shortage of towels for the 2 of us. Lastly, I booked this hotel through expedia and found a 10% off promotional code online at some random website. I just googled expedia promotional codes and I found it. The hotel wasn't overly expensive the way it was, so this made the 4 night stay even cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better location to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBabyBoomers
Reviews.Content: There is a lot that has been said about this hotel. I agree with ALL of the positive remarks and NONE of the negative remarks. Apparently the hotel went thru a change over the past 12-18 months and all for the better. We stayed in room 312. Corner room with ocean front view. The room was not the biggest but not the smallest we have ever stayed in. However, what do you do in a hotel room besides sleep and watch T.V. and get it on. Your suitcases know more about the room then you do. For us as long as the room is clean, bed is bed-bug free with clean linens, and the hotel is located in a safe location (day and night), that is about one really needs. The balcony was sufficient to walk out on to. Once again, not the largest balcony we have ever had in a hotel room but it was large enough to have 2 chairs with a table. From our room we were able to view a beautiful sunset each and every night. Keep in mind this hotel is on the public walkway for the beach - SO anticipate noise. We could occasionally hear skateboarders attempting tricks and hear music from our room with the doors closed. However, like any beach venue, things slowed down around 10:30 pm. We were able to open our balcony door every night and go to sleep listening to the waves and ocean sounds with out being disturbed by any man made noises. There is plenty to do with in walking and driving distance of this hotel. We liked it that Ralph's grocery store with a Starbucks was only 2 blocks away. Prices were reasonable, not outrageous.. This is a good place to stay both as an older couple OR for a family. We never heard our "hotel mates". We only saw other persons staying at the hotel when we came and went from our room Otherwise, we would have thought we were the only ones in the hotel and this was during Spring Break. Balboa park was beautiful and only a short 15 min drive, in busy traffic, away. We didn't take in any amusement parks etc, but passed them frequently as they are all close to this hotel. Side note: We ventured to Torrey Pines to see what the fuss was about the golf course and views. It is beautiful, so take in the sunsets from there if possible BUT skip the Hilton Torrey Pines. The food was outrageously priced and we didn't get what we paid for. There is just so much to do around San Diego that is so inexpensive. Take it all in. Parking at the hotel is NOT free. However, negotiate with the hotel manager for a discount. It is available...particularly if you mention a company that you work for. A lot of times they will knock off 1/2 or more for parking each day. The swimming pool is private - meaning no one other then hotel guests have access to it. You must have a room key to go in and out of the pool area. The view from the pool area isn't that great - in other words, you can't lay out and watch the beach BUT it is nice to lounge by. The children seemed to be having an awfully good time going from the hot tub to the pool as only kids can do.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location - can't get any closer to the beach anywhere you look!”
Reviews.Author: defreckster
Reviews.Content: I had a bus/pleasure trip and wanted to get oceanside. We had a wonderful time nestled right off the beach. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance and many shops. This location is great for the kids as well; we had a blast. The management was especially friendly, definitely coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beachfront Location”
Reviews.Author: CaNative07
Reviews.Content: To clarify, this review is for the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge on Pacific Beach -- just south of Crystal Pier and north of Mission Beach -- a great no-frills hotel. We went at the height of Spring Break and weren't expecting much. The fact that we got upgraded to a suite from a 2-queen room was a great bonus (probably because we were traveling with kids who wouldn't mind sleeping on a sofa bed). Secure access all around including private access to the boardwalk. If your car fits (our SUV did), also secured covered garage access -- well worth the daily charge in crowded Pacific Beach. Easy walk to great eateries and within 10 miles of San Diego airport, San Diego Zoo/Balboa Park, Sea World and Mission Bayfront area. About 30 miles south of San Diego Wild Animal Park. Excellent sunset views from the pool chaise lounges! Say it with me: on ... the ... beach. The only negative I can think of was that the maid service was a little unpredictable (one weekday, no service till 3:00), but were quick to respond when called. Overall, great location, great value, great experience -- would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Manager Kimberly Hubbard was absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sylviaDMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Diego late at night with no place to stay. Upon arrival, the staff was most considerate and found us a room for a great rate. When we decided to stay a few more nights, the staff and especially the Manager Kimberly Hubbard were most gracious and offered us a selection of rooms, including a suite with an ocean view for the same price as the king we had been in. They all went out of their way to accomodate us, provide directions and suggestions, and when we checked out and I asked to speak to her to compliment her and her staff, she then gave us chocolate chip cookies! The newly remodeled rooms are great too! Clean and very well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanview Down the Alley?”
Reviews.Author: SPARKLELasVegas
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews and prior experience at a sister property at Pismo Beach, my husband and I were looking forward to our "Oceanview" room at Pacific Beach while he attended a conference. Check in was quick-got room keys to room #344. Parking provided was covered garage but it was quite a trek to the elevator to get to the room. Opened the room and immeidately saw an open purse on the floor as well as a suitcase with clothes. Ooops-our room key worked just fine but someone else was already staying there. Very disconcerting. Thinking things happen sometimes and rolled our luggage all the way back to the lobby which was two buildings and three floors away. Asked for Matt the person who checked us in and he at first said it couldn't have happened (like we were lying!). Then he did something on the computer and said "oh my bad, I looked at the number wrong"-ran our cards back through the machine and told us it should be room 244. Never apologized or offered any other explanation. At this point I felt very uncomfortable and told my husband we'd be taking all valuables with us if we went out. Got to room 244 and immediately noticed the disinfectant smell obviously covering up what smelled like stale beer. The room was very small but adequate, however what we thought would be an oceanview room had a view into the bedroom of the old apartment complex immediately next door. Walking out onto the small balcony, you could see a view of the beach looking down an alley filled with garbage cans and cars. My husband went back once again to the desk to inquire about any other room that might be available and was told for a $60 additional/night fee we could get a partial ocean view in room 245. He brought the key back for us to view that room and once again it was just one room closer but the view wasn't any better-just didn't have the bedroom across from our window. When my husband went back to discuss with the desk clerk he was saying if we didn't like it and we checked out that we'd still have to pay the one night. No effort to help us get a better room whatsoever. Fortunately my Sprint Instinct phone located available rooms nearby and we ended up staying on the Crystal Pier "sleeping over the ocean" for only $40 more a night. Please ask if you can see your room before signing any papers or agreeing to stay. We are experienced, tolerant people who have reasonable expectations for service and accomodations. This was way below anything we have experienced recently and would not recommend to anyone. There are many other places to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean front suit and location, friendly staff, perfect holiday.”
Reviews.Author: GSnaily
Reviews.Content: Most pleasant stay, incredibly helpful staff, Kimberly made every effort to accommodate us, as did the Manager Reuben. Wonderful views and sunsetâ€™s from the ocean front suite. Our maid Caroline did an excellent cleaning job every day. Nice pool area overlooking the sea, shops all nearby. It certainly beats our winter in England. We would definitely like to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Ocean View”
Reviews.Author: KoHoSo
Reviews.Content: My sweetie wanted to go down to San Diego and visit some relatives for her birthday, and I couldn't stand to put her in just another ho-hum hotel for such a special day. After reading the other reviews here, I decided to take a chance on the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge and I am so glad that I did. I made my reservation online through the location's own website (not the general Best Western one) and the process was very easy. On extremely short notice, I was able to get a room with a full ocean view (keeping in mind this was in February during a bad economy -- I wouldn't expect the same in the summer). We did make the small mistake of driving into the Pacific Beach area down Garnet Avenue on a Saturday which was somewhat clogged with traffic and typical "beach bum" pedestrians, but I say "small" mistake because it gave us at least an idea of what all was along the area's main drag. For those in a hurry or who don't like traffic, I might recommend approaching the hotel on Grand Avenue or one of the many other smaller streets. However, do be warned that the entire area is a typical California beach town and that all of the streets are relatively narrow and that it's a place where parking spaces are very hard to find (except at one's hotel). Upon turning onto Pacific Beach Drive from Mission Boulevard, take the little turn area to the left just past the public restrooms that divide traffic and that is just before the street ends at the beach. Right in front of you will be the driving entrance to the hotel where you can park and enter the lobby. Because parking is at a premium in this area, they do charge $12 onto your stay if you do need a space (this is clearly mentioned on their site before making a reservation) -- do be aware that this is not uncommon all through San Diego and not just in Pacific Beach. We arrived quite early for the listed 4:00 check-in time, but we went in anyway just to check and see if our room was available. There was one couple already being helped at the counter, but a second gentleman working there saw us from the back and almost leaped out to immediately assist us. Both of the counter workers were extremely helpful and courteous. The one helping us said that there were already rooms available and that we could indeed check in early. Rooms with the full ocean view were available on any of the hotel's three floors, and I asked for the third so there would be no foot-stomping above us and we wouldn't be right in the face of the crowds walking by or the people enjoying the beach. After getting checked in and provided with our parking tag (there is even underground parking if desired), the guy helping us at the counter gave us a few tips and we were off to our room. We were given Room 361 on the far south corner facing the ocean. The room is small but they have made great use of one off-angle corner area where they placed a full-length mirror in order to make it seem larger. I want to stress that my use of the word "small" by no means should imply that the room is uncomfortable. It was extremely clean and well-kept. The only blemish I noticed during the entire trip on the inside was a small tear in the shade on the floor lamp. On the outside patio -- complete with two comfortable chairs and a table on which to sit one's favorite beverage -- any blemishes are due simply to the room's close proximity to the beach (as one can literally feel the very slight edge of the spray from the waves when the ocean reaches high tide). More on the inside -- the bed was extremely comfortable. There were two extra pillows provided in the closet to add to the three on the bed itself. Especially for those who recognize my avatar, there were plenty of places for our stuff even though the room size is small. The chairs and table were comfortable and sturdy, and the room contained a binder provided by the hotel that contained lots of information on the area. Robes are provided for your use that might look uncomfortable upon first glance, but are actually very cozy and handy. The bathroom was immaculate and well-stocked with towels. The shower/bathtub is sort of sunken down into the floor which I think made it more accessible to the handicapped. It was a little odd to get into but I think only because I wasn't used to it. I will caution those reading this that it is a little louder than other hotels when somebody next door uses their own shower and might be startling the first time it is heard. The pool area is very cool because it faces the ocean -- it is well-kept and very clean. The ice machine and soda pop are down on the first floor, but there is an elevator so that's no big deal if you don't want to take the stairs. The soda pop is, as usual, a bit on the expensive side and goes up to $2 if you want a bottle of Minute Maid Lemonade. On that front, you are better off taking the short walk across Pacific Beach Drive into the small strip mall that faces Mission Boulevard where there is a liquor/convenience store or taking a longer but reasonable walk north on Mission to Ralph's grocery store or a 7-Eleven that's further up. There is also a small cafÃ©/deli in the lobby of the hotel that was fairly full of people on Sunday morning, but we did not eat there. Most people should find that anything they want is within easy walking distance. I felt very safe even at night and even going down the narrow alleys that split up certain buildings and streets. The beach cannot be any closer. World Famous, The Eggery, and Ocean's Pizza are all basically just across the street, and much more in food, drink, and surf/gift shops are a few short blocks to the north. As mentioned above, parking is hard to get in Pacific Beach, so walking is the best way to go. However, due to the proximity to the ocean, the friendly people, and the relatively slow pace (as opposed to much of the rest of southern California), I don't look at that one bit as being a bad thing. For what one normally pays anywhere in the southern part of this state for anything with a view, this hotel cannot be beat. Unless you want to make reservations at least six months in advance for the Crystal Pier and pay even more, it is pretty much impossible to get an ocean view any closer to the sea. The patio view and the sound of the waves was worth every hard-earned penny an no other place in San Diego that I have ever stayed in -- all at much higher rates -- was better. Even if I could not get an ocean front view, I would still recommend this hotel for those looking to stay in Pacific Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: azgalcb
Reviews.Content: Picture welcoming smiles, comfortable rooms, sandy beach with great ocean views and rolling waves at your fingertips. Close to everything....You have arrived!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place and the Ass't Mgr”
Reviews.Author: lucypeh69
Reviews.Content: The Lodge is beautiful.....wonderful views of the ocean, clean, and the staff is very pleasant to work with....very quiet, and great location near everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: rjsncal
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location!! Right on the beach & boardwalk. Everything within walking distance so you don't have to drive after getting there. Mission Beach attractions, bars, restaurants, rentals, etc. Great knowledgeable staff with large rooms & all the amenities you need. Nice value for your buck & great for families. Newly remolded pool & spa that is incredible. A must place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time at the Blue Sea Lodge in San Diego!!”
Reviews.Author: 34R34R4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a two room suite overlooking the pools and the beach. The sound of the ocean was marvelous. The room was spacious and clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. We had plenty of sights and shopping within walking distance. I feel blessed to have found such a wonderful place! Thank you, Kimberly, for everything!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: sam1Ottawa
Reviews.Content: Ottawa, Ontario, Canada Our group travels to San Diego many times every year for business. We always stay at the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge. The staff are very nice. Rooms are always very clean. The location by the board walk is great. Access to bars and good restaurants within walking distance. I give this hotel a 5 start rating. I firmly believe it is well diserved. Should you be travelling to San Diego, I highly recommend the Blue Sea Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, superior customer service at the Blue Sea Lodge San Diego”
Reviews.Author: surf09
Reviews.Content: The Blue Sea Lodge is one of those special hotels that you never hear about. Located on the Pacific Beach area of San Diego right on the ocean and within walking distance to local shops and restaurants. Rooms are larger than expected and if you are lucky enough to get one facing the beach expect incredible sunsets! Customer service at this hotel remind me of the levels I have received at 4 and 5 star properties! The front desk was knowledgeable about local attractions and even offered discount coupons for several local restaurants. The Assistant Manager, Kimberly was extremely friendly and truely emulates customer service as she went out of her way to assure that we were comfortable and that everything exceeded our expectations for our stay. If you are looking for a great hotel on the beach in San Diego and don't want all the "fluff" and cost that comes with those higher tiered properties, then this small local beach hotel is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Quality at it's Best”
Reviews.Author: akastephens
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge. After a long flight we just wanted to get to our room and relax as fast as we could. We were immediately greeted by incredible service and a smile. It was so welcoming that the stress of traveling just melted away. We were seamlessly checked into our rooms which were just as incredible. We didn't think it could get much better until we saw the amazing view. Overall I would say this is probably one of the best hotels we have ever stayed

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel”
Reviews.Author: floridashark
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Blue Sea Lodge was a wonderful experience. We were looking for a comfortable hotel with a view of the ocean. Ocean view was spectacular to wake up to, so close you can fall asleep listening to the waves. We are a small family and enjoyed our stay here. The staff, facilities and location were very good, just to mention a few name Gabriel, Luis, Viri.
