The hotel is older......All the room was very clean, the housekeeping staff work very hard to maintain the rooms....The continental breakfast was very good although most Best Western offer free breakfast this was a small cost. The location was perfect. For a family with young children we were very pleased and would recommend this hotel to others. What we experienced was a fabulous location with staff that was very friendly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thrifty
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a huge disappointment from start to finish. We found it hard to believe this was the same hotel which had such good reviews. In fact, I find it difficult to say anything positive at all about this place and that is very unusual for me. The location is about the only single thing worth mentioning. Upon arrival, the lobby looked untidy and the staff were disinterested. We were refused an upgrade, although there were plenty of rooms available. The biggest disappointment was that the hotel swimming pool, which was supposedly one of the main features of this place, was being rebuilt. There was no advance notification of this and no apology offered. The room cleaning was dubious since our bathroom floor was never properly cleaned. The only vacuum in the hotel must have been out of service because the hallways were never cleaned once during our entire stay and there were objects permanently lying around. The service in the cafÃ© and the front desk, except for check-out, was minimal and unattentive. The lobby and cafÃ© area was untidy, bins overflowing, etc. Whoever manages this hotel was obviously not paying proper attention to the overall state of the property. First impressions are lasting impressions. Based on our experience, I cannot recommend this hotel and I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joey_2000
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at the blue sea lodge. Staff was great and very knowledgeable about the area. Its very convenient being by the beach as well as great restaurants. I definitely recomend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great place at the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Jaydee8
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a perfect location. Right of the Pacific Beach Boardwalk. Just steps away from the Beach. The Front Desk staff was very friendly, check in was quick and efficiant. Had a room on the 3rd Floor, from wich I could see the Ocean and enjoyed a beautiful sunset on the balcony. The room was very spacious and the bed was comfortable. Unfortunately the Breakfast was not included and the little Coffee Shop in the lobby was a little bit pricy. But could save some money on parking. Found a spot outside the Hotel lot wich was free. I definatly would come back to this property. You can`t beat this location!!

Reviews.Title: “HEAVEN BY THE BEACH”
Reviews.Author: llennard
Reviews.Content: When deciding on my choice of hotel for San Diego I really wanted to stay by the beach. Accommodation costs along the beach area is expensive so I decided to stay at Best Western even though there are quite mixed reviews from previous travellers. I am so pleased I chose Blue Sea Lodge. The ideal beach front location is so good especially at sunset. Taking recommendations from previous reviews my travel agent requested a 2nd or 3rd floor room and partial view. Avoid the pool area level or first floor, would be noisy. I arrived a few hours ahead of check-in but the front desk staff were so obliging. They discussed all the needed information of the local area as well as my room options. I was given room 370 partial ocean view plenty of space and clean and a perfect setting with a glass of wine on my balcony to watch the passing parade along Pacific Beach Blvd. The staff the hotel the guests the location was superb. Great restaurants, coffee shops, local supermarket all in walking distance from the hotel. San Diego Bus Metro at the front door for quick speedy travel to Old Town I had the most marvellous stay and will be returning to Blue Sea lodge my next visit to Pacific Beach San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mparis4386
Reviews.Content: This is a great location and right on the beach. I have stayed here several times. It is an older renovated hotel, but very comfortable. I do think it is a bit overpriced, but so is everything on Pacific Beach. Out of all the hotels beach side, this is definitely the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Pacific Beach!!!”
Reviews.Author: dfaler
Reviews.Content: Best Western Blue Sea Lodge is a really nice stay. There are not the ammenaties of a "resort" but who cares when you are right on the beach! Awesome location and Pacific beach is such a cool area that the location is the key. Rooms are nice with modern decor and flat screen TV's, clean and comfortable. Hotel is in Decent shape but you are paying for the location. Every morning we woke up to the sounds of the beach, ocean, seagulls, it was awesome. Pool is right on the beach and the strand with plenty of activity and people watching. Staff were great, check in was a breeze and we were upgraded from a ocean view room to ocean view suite. Overall great stay and great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “OK but not as good as reputation”
Reviews.Author: SamGreen_8
Reviews.Content: I booked the the room for $400 dollars per night and my neighorhood booked the room for $200 for the same type of room. I went to the front desk and asked them why and they told me their rates depend of occupancy. However, their rates always flows and they can tell you this rate and few minutes later they tell you different rate. When you check in they ask you to park at their parking slot and guess what, they do charge on parking for $12/night. Their rooms are small but very clean. Though the balcony is comparative small, the view is cool. I believe this hotel is alright but not like "award-winning" hotel. If you don't care about the hidden fees and flowing rates, bsl may not be a bad choice for their services and locations.

Reviews.Title: “Older Property, Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: TravlinLarry
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Blue Sea Lodge in July of '08. We stayed in one of the un-split rooms above the 1st level - a full suite which has one bedroom and a living area (see photo & please excuse the clutter!). Both rooms have a balcony that overlook the Pacific. The property is older, but it appears they are trying to keep up with maintenance. The elevator is a bit scary, but never failed us! The pool area is great as it overlooks the beach and you have a glass wall separating the pool from the boardwalk. As in previous posts, you probably don't want to be on the first floor if your room is on the end nearest the ocean due to noise. Activity goes well into the night. My biggest gripe is that the carpet was filthy in our unit. Put on white socks, walk around 1 minute, and the socks are dark brown on the bottom. That's the one maintenance area we found seriously lacking. Other than that, houskeeping was great. Lots of restaurants are within walking distance. Our favorite became the "Green Flash" just down the beach. Bike rentals are $5 (off site) and are really worth it to travel the full length of the boardwalk! Yes, they do charge for parking - it is at a premium around the beach. However, for this fee, you get to park underneath the building in covered, secured parking. I felt it worth the price. I would stay again, but it appeared there were many vacation rentals available just down the beach. For a three night stay, this might be a better deal for 3 or more people. There were also newer-looking hotels farther north.

Reviews.Title: “We had a nice stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: newmexicomommy
Reviews.Content: We only had a short time to stay in San Diego, so I didn't want to waste time traveling back and forth to the beach. I found this and a couple of other hotels in San Diego that were ON THE BEACH and picked this one at the request of my husband, who felt more comfortable going with an established "brand name." (Best Western) The area, Pacific Beach, is very crowded both with residents and travelers. However, upon our request we were placed in a room that was VERY quiet and faced an apartment house next door rather than the beach or the pool. This was important to us as we have a toddler who goes to bed early and is a light sleeper. I know we had people staying in the rooms on either side of us and above us, but I never heard them. The only time we had a problem with noise was when the noisy frat boys staying under us decided to have a drink on their patio at 2:30 in the morning (more on that later). They didn't stay outside long (I think someone had complained about the noise, and they went inside) and we didn't have another problem with it on other nights. We did have a small balcony, which was nice, as well as a table with two chairs and a bar with two barstools where our toddler could eat his meals. The room we got was nice, very clean, the bathroom looked like it had been recently refurbished. The bedspread, couch and some other furnishings were a bit worn but nothing we couldn't live with. The room had a queen bed and a pullout queen sofa. With the sofa folded up, the room was spacious; with the bed out, not so much, so we only left the bed out at nighttime. Overall it was a pretty average room but we don't have champagne tastes :) There was good closet space but the bathroom does not have a bathtub, perhaps for water-conservation reasons. We had to have our 2-year-old take showers with us instead of the baths he is used to, which was a new experience for him, but not a problem; actually after the first time he enjoyed the shower a lot. The hotel's common areas are a little worse for the wear and it's apparent the hotel has been there for some time, but otherwise are OK. We saw hotel workers painting, cleaning, etc. the whole time we were there, so I think they are trying to keep up with it, but with a large volume of people through the building, plus the sea air to contend with, it's probably an uphill battle. Everything was clean and the hotel does have some nice amenities, including a microwave and refrigerator in the room we got along with a washer and dryer on the floor beneath us to wash seawater-soaked towels and clothes. There is on-site parking you pay extra for, which I was glad to have after I saw how congested the general area is and watched people circle to find parking places. Despite high foot traffic in the area the parking lot for the hotel is secure and we didn't have any problems with our car when we were there. There is a Ralph's grocery store about 2 blocks from the hotel, so we were able to buy groceries and keep them in the in-room refrigerator, which was great for us and would be a real advantage to this hotel over others, as it's always helpful (I think) to be able to keep some food in the room. The pool was nice but be aware I think they use purified saltwater for it; the water was very salty for pool water, but the pool was clean and the area was well-policed for garbage, etc. The best part of all was the beach access: walk past the pool to a door in the glass wall facing the ocean, and you are on the boardwalk with the beach just steps away. We could hear the ocean from our side-facing room (although we couldn't see it unless we looked around the corner of the building, but that was fine with us :) and that, to me, was the best part of the hotel. The one advisory I have for families is that this area is apparently Party Central for high school and college kids looking to hang out on the beach. The boardwalk in front of the hotel has constant activity and is quite loud (shouting, laughing, boomboxes and stereos going, etc.). I would not have wanted to stay in the front of the building facing the beach, or facing the pool; it would have just been way too noisy. The boardwalk was a very interesting place to take walks but I don't know if I would have wanted to put up with it for longer than the three days we were there. If you are looking for peace and quiet, this is probably NOT the hotel to stay in in San Diego. For us, having a small child, it could have been a disadvantage. If you have teenagers, however, I would think this would be a great place to stay as they would have plenty of opportunities to meet other teenagers. The area is well-patrolled by police, lifeguards, and private security from the hotels, so there wouldn't be much fear of anything bad happening. All in all, though, I found the hotel to be very pleasant and was satisfied with what we got for the amount of money we paid. We have stayed at places with far fewer amenities that cost more money in other cities we have visited. I am not sure we would stay here again if we were going to be in town longer next time, but I would recommend this to other travelers who don't mind (or are actively seeking) a lot of activity where they stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Location, Grungy Motel”
Reviews.Author: attymom
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a serene beach getaway, this is NOT the place. If you are okay with rowdy beachy "looking for a party" kinda atmosphere, this is perfectly fine. You are right on the boardwalk. It is a lot a fun people watching, shopping for trinkets, renting bikes and riding on the boardwalk. We did all that & had a good time. The hotel/lodge itself has a lot to be desired. The rooms are crummy. Bad furniture, minimum decor. Funny smell. You know, cheap. But it wasn't cheap! This must be the only BW that do not serve breakfast. Does have free wireless. Paid $12 per day for parking. A lot can be forgiven b/c of the location. However, the TV remote did not work and they did not/could not fix it and offered us no solution. That was a major inconvenience and sucked. The pool area is teeny weeny and not enough chairs. Again, a lot can be forgiven b/c of the location, but can't forgive the TV remote.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: on-the-journey
Reviews.Content: WOW!! This hotel is in a great location, but I wasn't sure what to expect. Well, I was pleasantly surprised. My ocean view room was very nice, with a flat screen tv mounted to the wall, and very nice furnishings. And what an amazing place to watch the sun set.

Reviews.Title: “My Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: BillyRave
Reviews.Content: Absolute ocean front in San Diego - what could be better? I've been a regular guest at this hotel for over 20 years, through numerous management and ownership changes, because of its location and staff. It's a fairly small hotel with 128 rooms total, only a portion of which are true 'oceanfront', the rest being so-called 'partial view' (the rooms are 'perpendicular' to the beach, so the ocean & sun view are at an angle) - if you want the entire horizon as seen from your balcony to be ocean (and that is breathtaking - see my photo), be sure to specify, though of course those rooms are more expensive. Except for suites, rooms are fairly small; when first opened, it was all-suite, but eventually the suites got split into two rooms, making for some very tight quarters. Rooms all include mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, iron & ironing board, CD clock radio, a small safe (big enough to stash a small camera bag, not the wallet&jewelry 'glove compartment' size I've seen elsewhere), and recent upgrades added flat-screen TVs in the ocean-front rooms; there is also a guest laundry. The original main building is U-shaped, with a modest pool and small jacuzzi located between the wings, facing the ocean; lazing in lounge chairs provides a great view of the ocean and the passers-by on the boardwalk. The hotel is adjacent to the paved boardwalk which runs from south Mission Beach up through Pacific Beach. The good news is that the boardwalk provides a perfect (albeit mobbed in summer) oceanfront walk (or skate, blade, bikeride, et al - all rentable options in the immediate area); the bad news is that skateboarders make a lot of noise on concrete, and they and other locals often hang out on & along the boardwalk into the late evening (again, more often in summer). The latest expansion of the hotel added a coffee shop, which (as of my last visit) stays open until about noon, but for a serious meal, you have to venture out ; there are numerous restaurants, many oceanfront, within a very short walk, including 'World Famous' and Tony Roma's, both just across the street. The former is oceanfront, the latter in a mini-mall; also within a short walk north are a host of other restaurants, as well as a drug store and a supermarket. The hotel has its own outdoor and underground parking lots (be warned - the spaces are ludicrously undersized, seemingly designed for compacts, and in the summer space is at a premium!), and charges a daily parking fee. Jump in your car and the downtown Pacific Beach shopping area is about a mile away, spectacular downtown La Jolla 10 minutes' drive north, and Sea World 10 minutes' drive south. There are several other oceanfront hotels in the immediate area, with roughly the same amenities for comparable rates, though most sit further back (mixed blessing) from the boardwalk and ocean, some are just too chic ('No bare feet or bathing suits in lobby' in one totally turned me off), and this is the only one (I believe) which is part of a chain - those high summer rates rack up a lot of points on my Best Western account!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: rizzay
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you just want a place to crash in a beautiful area of SD. My experience was neither amazing or disappointing. The room was spacious and clean, but it had an anti-view (literally, the window faced a wall of some sort. I think it's because we got there late at night). There are tons of restaurants within walking distance (a great sea food spot across the parking lot). Tons of bars, and of course, the beach. I don't have any complaints except that its slightly too pricey considering the lack of perks in the hotel itself. You pay for location, and it's really up to you to decide what thats worth. Great for singles, friends and young folks who want to have a great time in a fun environment.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Front on Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: scooter60
Reviews.Content: The Blue Sea Lodge in San Diego (located on Pacific Beach)offers many types of rooms from which to choose . Poolside, ocean view, ocean front, and parking lot views are available. We stayed in an ocean front view. We loved watching the surf and the mass of humanity, but there were few things we didn't love. If you plan on staying at this hotel in an oceanfront room, we suggest you don't get a room on the first floor. Since we were basically on the beach walk-way, there was noise and commotion. The balcony patios (on all of the first level rooms) connected without any barriers between rooms. We thought this could certainly be a safety hazard. Our room (one kingsize bed) was rather small. The poolside rooms were much larger, but of course, had oceanview rooms. No restaurant, but a little shop to buy quick breakfast items. Plenty of drink and snack machines. The Blue Sea is within walking distance of many restaurants and shopping which made it very accessible for evening outings. The hotel staff was friendly and quick to respond to questions regarding the area. I would stay there again but definitely reserve a 2nd or 3rd floor ocean front room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! clean room”
Reviews.Author: davetek
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great, next to all the shops and beach. Booked room on the first floor with partial ocean view. The room has a mirror placed at a smart angle that allows you to see the ocean from inside the room. Try staying at the west building, its closer to the beach. No significant street or party noise. The bad: parking was $10 a day, restaurant is small and limited to breakfast, if you don't like crowds or high traffic try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed at Best Western Sea Lodge”
Reviews.Author: floridagirl288
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 8 night stay at this motel and this was our first visit to San Diego . This motel is divided into two buildings, the back bdlg faces the street and has been refurbished. The front bldg faces the pool and the beach, we stayed in room 354 in the front bldg as we wanted a view, I was told on the phone each room had was like a suite, wrong, only the front rooms are suites. Our room looked like a old motel room in dire need of repairs, we had 7 hangers each (we went out and bought some) 3 small drawers, a small frig, a microwave and a small patio overlooking a rooftop of a bldg next to us. You can tell this is a hotel that kids like as it is close to the local hangouts and bars. If you want quiet, this is NOT the place to stay. My daughter also stayed here and they had to be moved twice before they could settle on a room that looked clean. We would not stay here again, for the price of 2900 (2 room) we could have rented a condo for a week. ($15.00 tax a day, 8.00 a day parking)

Reviews.Title: “lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: bk4444
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel its right on beach. Its right near all popular restraunts . The blue sea lodge staff was helpfull. IF you stay there make sure you get one of the front suites they over look the boardwalk .highly recomend the parking is a little tight room was great and very clean . W.kaye vic b.c canada

Reviews.Title: “Hip location”
Reviews.Author: RedCharrlize
Reviews.Content: It's three days pass since I came back from my vacation @ San Diego. The hotel location was just right for me it's across from the beach, just the boardwalk separating it. In the early evening you could catch the sunset which is gorgeous. Make sure you book an oceanfront . My mistake, I didn't believed the reviews that it's worth getting the oceanfront. I booked just the ordinary room w/ king size bed. I got there early and the room wasn't ready until 3p.m. which is their check-in time so I had to wait. Have the chance to walk and survey area for restaurants. Came back and check-in to my booked room.... The size was okay but what I didn't like about it was the view of the wall from the next door building. Na-ah, not working for me. So went back to front desk, and requested for another room available with a view. Offered me an oceanfront with upgraded fee-checked it out first before I said ok. Love it, accepted it and the rest was history. My BIG advise GET an OCEANFRONT VIEW, it's worth it. Cleanliness rank ok. And forgot to tell you, It includes a flat screen t.v. in the rooom-COOL. Downside:No generator in cases of brownouts which I experienced during my stay. Meaning no wake-up call. Good thing I got out of bed just in time for my appointment

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Better Then Being By The Ocean!”
Reviews.Author: eitter
Reviews.Content: Sometimes you just have to put things in perspective. I am from So. Cal and also lived in Hawaii, the ocean does tremondous damage to buildings along the shore, just a reality. Places try to keep up, but when people like me leave the windows open all day and night and let the indcreible breeze and sounds of the waves come in, you will get a musty smell. Yes the beach can get noisy, and yes we had some, but still being on the ocean out weights that too! We reserved an ocean front King room for the weekend, July 7th-9th. I paid whatever I had to to get that room and it was a lot. You see I have cancer and undergoing Chemo treatments. For me it was worth the price, the noise, the small parking spaces. Just to sit on my balcony and see the ocean, I cannot go out in the sun, so I looked from our room. I would also rise at dawn and go out at sunset and walk the beach each day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: sometimetraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and loved it. We had an oceanview room with a balcony. There was some noise from the beach, but not from other rooms. Front desk was helpful when we asked where to eat, visit, etc. The room was clean, parking was protected, and access to the beach was through a secure door. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “noisy hotel with very limited and cramped parking!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel from June 23rd for 3 nights, we planned to stay a week but we were so disappointed we left early. The hotel is very noisy, there were people running up and down the halls all night, many young adults were up all night yelling from the balconies. You can also hear through the walls. Sure the beach is near the hotel, but you cannot keep your window open to hear the waves due to the noise all night. The parking is terrible, the spaces are so close and the garage under the hotel is so cramped our car did get a very deep dent while staying there, and they charge for parking each night. If you want to party all night this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will seek a new hotel for the next San Diego visit”
Reviews.Author: dmcginnus
Reviews.Content: Dear Blue Sea Lodge award-winning staff: We are already anticipating our return to your hotel. Of course that trip will take place once your 'final touches' of the remodeling efforts are complete. We are confident that your staff is feverishly in the middle of the upgrades as of this writing - probably just down to picking out new paint colors? Who knows? Maybe you only had to finish up with the room we occupied? Whatever the case may be, we can only hope the outcome will include removal of all the rusted out metal on the balcony, broken bath tiles, dingy carpet, old air conditioning unit, beds made of marshmallows, and you might want to have the smoke alarms installed on the ceiling instead of laying on the floor. By the way (just something to think about), in order to effectively "FIX" an electrical outlet (your parking garage and spa areas come to mind), you need to consider doing more than covering the switches with duct tape (although the colored tape was a nice touch over the same-old gray). Yes, electricians are quite expensive...hmmmm, come to think of it, SO ARE YOUR RATES. Figuring you must net a nice profit per day per room, you might dig deep for a couple of bucks so that a professional can correct these things to keep your place up to code. Even with the "less than award winning" room, we could not let the "lesser than award winning spa and pool" go by without a comment. Nice to see that there were plenty of used pool towels available for our use. It was uncanny how day and night, there were no towels available. No bother, we did bring our own, of course why would we need them? The pool AND spa were covered end-to-end with screaming children who's parents found it to be the perfect playground for water polo and splashing events. What can one say about the relaxing spa? The beautiful yellowish hue at night, the smell? We'd rather block that from our memory. Oh well, even though the pool, spa and room were probably a smidgeon below "award winning", we decided to get a little ice from one of the two antique ice machines to chill our beverages so that we could imbibe on the beach while watching the incredible sunset. Did I say, ice? What ice? By the end of our stay, we determined that between 3:00-4:00am, the machine would casually dispense ice, otherwise, yep, empty. At least you can't duct tape over the sunset! Last, but not least, we REALLY enjoyed winning the coffee lottery on day 1 and day 5 of our visit. We're glad your "award-winning" staff was looking out for us and our caffeine intake. One more thing, you could probably do without the alarm clocks, they're unnecessary unless you're in a third floor room. Just hire the family who was in the room above us to stay above guests on the morning of departure. They seem to be up and jumping around 6ish EVERY DAY. Again, it was memorable, so was appendicitis and the Steelers losing Super Bowl XXX. Best regards. D.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the internet and I was skeptical from the beginning. I wanted something on the beachfront but all others were booked so I called the Blue Sea and felt better about booking it after speaking to the reservations manager. I should have gone with my first instinct. From the moment we stepped into the elevator from the underground parking garage, I knew we were in trouble. The elevator was dirty and smelly. As we got out on the third floor the carpet was dingy and the halls had an awful smell. Then when We walked into our "queen" oceanfront room, WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT! Small is an understatement. Tiny is more like it and for the price I had to pay, it wasn't worth a third of that. There was only two of us and we were constantly in each other's way. No room to move and the bed was only a double, not queen. It was smelly, dingy and overall, disgusting. If this is considered a three-diamond property I'd hate to see their one-diamond. It was a total waste of money. The ONLY good thing was the view, which is a given anyway. Afterall, it was facing the ocean. We walked up the beach and found a "great" place that had a vacancy and it was $30 a night cheaper and the room was HUGE. It was beautiful! We went back to the Blue Sea and reluctantly stayed one night and moved over to this other place, that was UNBELIEVABLE! The Blue Sea is terrible. If you're considering beachfront and don't care about the room or the money, book it. But take this advice, don't waste your time, you'll be COMPLETELY disappointed and ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars to Location and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: HOADLYVA
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights at The Blue Sea Lodge for my family. We had been to San Diego before and were familiar with the town, hotels, etc. At check in, Karin was very courteous, informative and friendly. She upgraded us to a suite, being that I am a Gold Crown Club member, and hold there credit card. We were thrilled and amazed! We had a large livingroom with a pullout sofa, large dining table and comfy chairs, refrigerator, microwave, large bath with jacuzzi tub, and a king bedroom, 2 tv's , and the best part....a large outdoor patio with dining table, chaise lounges, right at poolside with a terrific ocean view. The staff was great, got us extra towels, blankets, we really felt "looked after". It is within walking distance to Tony Roma's and World Famous, which we highly recommend as well! The grounds and rooms are well kept, the management looks after the pool area almost hourly on the weekends to make sure your stay is quiet and lovely. Rueben, the manager is very helpful and on top of everything. What a pleasure to stay at such a great establishment. I can't wait to go back for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun in PB”
Reviews.Author: terrapinstation
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband April 15-22. The hotel was pretty much what I expected after reading the reviews here: the rooms were clean, the location was AWESOME, and we fell asleep every night to the sound of the waves. The hotel staff was very friendly and there were a lot of families there during our stay. Yes, there were some "colorful" people to observe along the boardwalk, but that just makes for better people-watching in my mind. Make sure you do a web search for San Diego coupons before you visit; we found lots of coupons for restaraunts in the PB area and the city at large (I recommend Mission Cafe for breakfast- YUM!). Overall, we loved our visit to beautiful San Diego and the hotel suited us perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ocean surf sound”
Reviews.Author: MoonwatcherVienna
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter and I spent three nights during Spring Break 2006 at this hotel. Our room was clean, and included a partial ocean view; ie, only visible from our balcony overlooking the small pool, or, weirdly enough, backwards in the mirrored wall. The plus side: great location, good restaurants nearby, plenty of parking in April, wonderful ocean noise at night. Bad vibes: drunks in the jacuzzi at 10:30 at night, but that could happen in any hotel. I plan on going back, but I would ask for an ocean front room as available. Also, I was told the whole location is incredibly crowded in the summer. But, we always try to stay in Best Westerns when we travel, as overall I find them safe and a decent value for what you get. Bottom line: you can't beat the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Author: jerryjfm
Reviews.Content: We go to Pacific Beach once a year and stay at least 2 days. We payed a bit more and and got an ocean front room on the 3rd floor.This was our first time at this hotel. I did alot of reserch and there was some really bad reviews on line. We went any way.We got in late afternoon and watched the sunset from our bed. Add to that the sound of the waves from the ocean. WOW, it was so nice! We spent a lot of time just enjoying the sounds. Then there are some nice places to eat and lots of places to go that are close.We had a great time and will be back for sure!!! Go on the off season or week day if you hate the crowds. Jerry & Lonni

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location Location......”
Reviews.Author: stevee33
Reviews.Content: The reviews were mixed about this hotel.But I still heard everyone say it was right on the ocean.BOY IS IT. I had a great 5 day stay at the Blue Sea.Booked Expedia for $99/night.There are a few sections,some not on the beach.A simple $10 bill in the check in girls palm promted her to say "How 'bout an ocean front room".It was a very nice room(only a queen bed) nice bathroom,fridge, sink and microwave. The pool was heated and swimmable,and the jacuzzi was great. My room was steps away from the Promanade(boardwalk),and morning walks were great.There are some homeless people and a few screwballs walking around,but don't let that bother you it was safe.Pacific beach is great, many bars and restaurants and there is an A.A. club nearby for friends of Bill W.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: WendMc
Reviews.Content: Disneyland is magical! After about four days it was perfect to wind down our Disney excitement by driving down the coast to San Diego for a few days. Sea World and the San Diego Zoo were well worth the trip. We booked our family of five into this perfectly situated hotel. The rooms were standard and little small. We didn't have enough room for a roll away cot but our kids were small enough to share 1 queen bed. The location was perfect. We had a view of the beach and the ocean and were right on the walkway along the shoreline. In the morning it was fun to grab a coffee from one of the coffee shops and later in the day we enjoyed trying out one of the many restaurants in the area.
